Headlines: CDC Issues New Guidelines for Meningococcal Vaccination
Teaser: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's new meningococcal immunization recommendations call for vaccination of all adolescents 11 to 18 years of age.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Cervical Cancer Vaccine
Teaser: Applauded as one of the most important advances in women's health in recent years, experts say this vaccine and others like it could help save millions of lives worldwide.

Headlines: Highlights From MMWR: CDC Reports on Imported Polio Case and More
Teaser: The CDC has reported on a case of imported vaccine-associated paralytic poliomyelitis, influenza vaccination rates in children aged 6 to 23 months, and the rate of midwife-attended births in the US.

Headlines: Menactra May be Linked to Cases of Guillain-Barre Syndrome
Teaser: The FDA and CDC investigate 5 cases of GBS in recipients of a quadrivalent meningococcal vaccine.

Headlines: Renal Tumor Cell Vaccine After Radical Nephrectomy Reduces Risk of Tumor...
Teaser: However, editorialists urge caution in face of possible problems in the design of the phase III, unblinded randomized trial.

Headlines: Vaccines for Kids Show High Return on Investment
Teaser: If childhood vaccines in resource-poor countries were considered as an investment, their returns would be enormous, according to a new study.

Headlines: Swine H1N1 Influenza Vaccine Could Reduce Supply of Seasonal Flu Vaccine
Teaser: The US government's tentative plan to develop a stand-alone vaccine for the swine-origin H1N1 influenza virus could strain the nation's vaccine makers to the point of reducing production of seasonal flu vaccine this fall, according to experts.

Headlines: Potential Impact of Swine Flu: An Expert Interview With Neal A. Halsey, MD
Teaser: Swine influenza could significantly affect public health by causing not only influenza-related morbidity and potential mortality, but also by diverting resources from other important immunization initiatives.

Headlines: American Academy of Pediatrics Updates Guidelines for Use of Rotavirus Vaccine
Teaser: A second rotavirus vaccine has been licensed since the American Academy of Pediatrics first published guidelines regarding prevention of rotavirus gastroenteritis in January 2007.

Headlines: Prostate Cancer Vaccine Improves Survival
Teaser: T cell immunotherapy for advanced prostate cancer shows promise and improves 3-year survival by 38% (more than 4 months).

Headlines: Reducing Mother-to-Child HBV Transmission
Teaser: Combining antihepatitis B virus therapy in pregnant Chinese women with vaccination of the infant provides a 2-fold risk reduction of the vaccine failure rate, from 39% to 18%.

Headlines: Vaccination Against Chronic HCV
Teaser: A DNA-based therapeutic vaccination against chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) shows a sustained HCV-specific T-cell response and reduction in viral load.

Headlines: ACOG Issues Recommendations on Routine Pelvic Exam, Cervical Cytology Screening
Teaser: ACOG decided to issue the guidelines because the advent of the human papillomavirus vaccine has given rise to some confusion about when, and in whom, to perform periodic health assessments in women.

Headlines: FDA Approves Expanded Age Indication for Tdap Booster Vaccine
Teaser: The tetanus toxoid/reduced diphtheria toxoid/acellular pertussis single-dose booster vaccine (Boostrix) is approved for persons aged 10 to 64 years; it was initially licensed only for persons aged 10 to 18 years.

Headlines: New TB Vaccine Is Safe, Highly Immunogenic in Patients With Latent Infection
Teaser: In a phase 1 trial, MVA85A was safe and highly immunogenic, which should facilitate further trials in tuberculosis-endemic areas.

Headlines: Vaccine Safety Communication: An Expert Interview With Patricia Stinchfield, RN, MS, CPNP
Teaser: At the National Association of Pediatric Nurse Practitioners 30th Annual Conference, Ms. Stinchfield discussed strategies to communicate with parents, children, and adolescents about immunization.

Headlines: ACIP Issues 2009 Adult Immunization Schedule
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices has issued the recommended adult immunization schedule for 2009.

Headlines: Child's Death Is First of Flu Season
Teaser: The CDC reports a Minnesota child is the first influenza-related death.

Headlines: Flu Shot Linked to Reduced Risk of VTE
Teaser: The link between influenza vaccination and reduced pulmonary embolism or deep vein thrombosis was particularly marked in younger subjects, researchers say.

Headlines: Vaccine Shows No Benefit in Renal Cell Carcinoma
Teaser: The heat-shock protein peptide complex, which was showing promise in early study, has failed a phase 3 trial.

Headlines: Nicotine Conjugate Vaccine to Quit Smoking
Teaser: A study shows that NicVAX antibodies prevent nicotine from reaching the brain, interrupting drug reinforcement and resulting in smoking cessation.

Headlines: Increasing Influenza Immunization Coverage
Teaser: A school-based trial implemented in 2007/08 efficiently increased influenza-immunization coverage in elementary schools.

Headlines: Most Influenza Strains Do Not Match Current Vaccine
Teaser: Vaccination is still beneficial, although protection may not be optimal, flu expert said.

Headlines: CDC: Adult Vaccination Rates Too Low
Teaser: Only 2% of eligible adults have had a shingles vaccine, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

Headlines: New Meningitis Vaccine May Offer Better Immunity in Infants
Teaser: In a randomized controlled trial, the new vaccine was better able to produce immunity in infants than the current meningococcal tetravalent glycoconjugate vaccine and was well tolerated.

Headlines: Full Pneumococcal Immunization Strongly Advised for Patients With Cochlear
Teaser: Deaths resulting from pneumococcal meningitis may have been preventable with vaccination.

Headlines: H1N1 Flu Vaccine Trials Set to Launch
Teaser: Clinical trials of 2 H1N1 influenza vaccines will begin shortly to assess vaccine safety and efficacy in anticipation of a fall outbreak.

Headlines: FDA Approves Influenza Vaccine for 2009-2010 Season
Teaser: Although the vaccine will not protect individuals against H1N1 influenza A infection, the FDA emphasizes the importance of continuing to receive prophylaxis against seasonal influenza strains.

Headlines: H1N1 Flu Vaccine Fast-Tracked to September?
Teaser: The National Biodefense Safety Board has recommended in a unanimous vote to skip all but the most preliminary clinical tests of vaccine safety and effectiveness.

Headlines: CDC Not Worried About Supply of H1N1 Vaccine
Teaser: The US should have an adequate supply of the influenza A (H1N1) vaccine this fall despite reports of snags encountered by manufacturers and fears that they could break their contracts with the United States.

Headlines: US Preparing for Fall H1N1 Flu Season
Teaser: Public health officials and delegations from 54 states, tribes, and territories at the H1N1 Influenza Preparedness Summit discussed a 4-pronged approach to preparation for the fall 2009 influenza season.

Headlines: HPV Vaccination Program Reduces the Incidence of Genital Warts in Both Sexes
Teaser: A free HPV vaccine program was associated with a reduction in risk for genital warts within a few years.

Headlines: Final Analysis Shows HPV Vaccine Is Effective and Safe
Teaser: The final results of a large phase 3 trial demonstrate that Cervarix, an AS04-adjunvanted vaccine, was immunogenic, generally well tolerated, and effective against HPV-16 or HPV-18 infections.

Headlines: HPV Vaccination Is Not Cost-Effective in the Netherlands
Teaser: Even under the most favorable assumptions, the HPV vaccine was not found to be cost effective, Dutch researchers report.

Headlines: Quadrivalent HPV Vaccine May Be Effective in Women 24 to 45 Years Old
Teaser: In a randomized trial, the quadrivalent human papillomavirus vaccine was efficacious in women aged 24 to 45 years who were not infected with the relevant types at enrollment.

Headlines: Vaccine Fights Melanoma
Teaser: An experimental vaccine shrinks tumors in people with deadly skin cancer.

Headlines: Pneumococcal Vaccines Prevent Invasive Disease in Infants: Meta-Analysis
Teaser: According to a meta-analysis, pneumococcal conjugate bacterial vaccines can prevent invasive disease caused by Streptococcus pneumoniae in healthy infants up to age 24 months.

Headlines: Vaccine in Follicular Lymphoma Produces Significant Effect
Teaser: A vaccine for follicular lymphoma has been shown to improve disease-free survival, but there are questions about how it will fit alongside current therapy.

Headlines: Minimum Interval DTaP Schedule May Increase Receipt of Other Vaccines
Teaser: A minimum interval schedule of diphtheria and tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine was positively linked with receipt of inactivated polio vaccine and pneumococcal conjugate vaccine.

Headlines: Unvaccinated Kids Getting Whooping Cough
Teaser: Children of parents who refuse vaccines are more likely to get whooping cough.

Headlines: Flu Vaccination in Children With Asthma
Teaser: Trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine was not an effective protection against hospitalization in pediatric populations, particularly in children with asthma; but experts agree that this is not a reason to stop vaccinating children with asthma, because the vaccine is still helpful in making protective antibodies.

Headlines: Communicating Vaccine Safety to the Public
Teaser: Healthcare professionals must educate parents that not vaccinating children poses serious risks to the health of individual children, as well as to the public.

Headlines: WHO Panel Will Weigh Full-Scale Production of H1N1 Vaccine, May Halt Seasonal Vaccine Production
Teaser: The World Health Organization (WHO) will convene a panel of experts on May 14 to consider whether to initiate large-scale production of a vaccine for the swine-origin influenza A (H1N1) virus as well as whether to halt production of next fall's seasonal flu vaccine.

Headlines: Vaccination Order for Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine May Affect Infant Pain Response
Teaser: Infants who receive pneumococcal conjugate vaccine after the combination vaccine for diphtheria, polio, tetanus, pertussis, and Haemophilus influenzae type b appear to have less pain than those who are immunized in the reverse order.

Headlines: Expanded Program on Immunization (EPI) Schedule: An Expert Interview With Neal A. Halsey, MD
Teaser: In his presentation at the National Foundation for Infectious Diseases 12th Annual Conference on Vaccine Research, Dr. Halsey recommended modifying the current schedule, which is now 25 years old, to a 2-dose series for most vaccines, with a booster at 12 months.

Headlines: WHO: H1N1 Vaccine Will Take 4 to 6 Months to Make
Teaser: Seasonal influenza vaccine is likely to have no effect on the new influenza A (H1N1) strain, the World Health Organization said today, and a new vaccine will take about 4 to 6 months to make.

Headlines: FDA Approves 4 Vaccines for 2009 H1N1 Influenza
Teaser: The FDA has approved 4 vaccines against the 2009 influenza A (H1N1) virus, formerly known as "swine flu." The vaccine lots are expected to be available and distributed within the next 4 weeks.

Headlines: New NIH Studies Support Effectiveness for Single-Dose H1N1 Vaccine
Teaser: Initial results corroborate and reinforce recent findings that a single dose of the influenza A (H1N1) vaccine is well-tolerated and produces a protective response in adults.

Headlines: Single-Dose Monovalent H1N1 Vaccine Appears to Be Immunogenic
Teaser: Two studies suggest that the monovalent 2009 influenza A (H1N1) vaccine appears to be immunogenic in adults, with mild to moderate vaccine-associated reactions.

Headlines: Nonadjuvanted Influenza Vaccines May Not Protect Against 2009 H1N1
Teaser: Vaccination with recent seasonal nonadjuvanted influenza vaccines induced little or no cross-reactive antibody response to 2009 H1N1 in any age group.

Headlines: HPV Vaccines: Cervarix and Gardasil Use in Boys and Men
Teaser: An FDA Advisory Committee voted to recommend approval of a second human papillomavirus vaccine and to expand approval of Gardasil to boys and men.

Headlines: CDC Updates Guidelines on Management of 2009 H1N1 Influenza
Teaser: Although the recommended drugs remain unchanged, the CDC's updated guidelines include a "watchful waiting" option for prophylaxis and emphasize the need for prompt treatment in high-risk patients.

Headlines: American Academy of Pediatrics Updates Flu Recommendations
Teaser: The AAP has updated current recommendations for routine use of trivalent seasonal influenza vaccine and antiviral medications for the prevention and treatment of influenza in children.

Headlines: Swine Flu Vaccine: Will It Catch On?
Teaser: Some health care workers and the public may refuse the new flu vaccine for fear of possible side effects, according to a study

Headlines: CDC Reports H1N1 Cases Already Increasing; Urges Vaccination of Children
Teaser: The number of H1N1 influenza cases reported continued throughout the summer and is already increasing; the CDC is urging vaccination of all school-aged children as soon as a vaccine becomes available.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: Actonel, Gardasil, Myfortic
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for risedronate sodium tablets, human papillomavirus quadrivalent [recombinant] vaccine, and mycophenolic acid delayed-release tablets.

Headlines: Report New Cases of Guillain-Barré After H1N1 Flu Vaccine
Teaser: The American Academy of Neurology is teaming up with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to ask neurologists to remain vigilant in tracking any new cases of the autoimmune disease.

Headlines: H1N1 Test Approved for US Troops Serving Overseas
Teaser: The 2009 H1N1 influenza virus test is now approved for use in detecting the virus in troops serving overseas, the FDA has announced.

Headlines: ACIP Issues Guidelines for Use of Influenza A (H1N1) Monovalent Vaccine
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices has provided recommendations regarding the use of vaccine against infection with novel influenza A (H1N1) virus.

Headlines: First H1N1 Flu Vaccine Trials Underway
Teaser: Trials to evaluate the safety of the H1N1 vaccine are underway. However, no concerns have been raised to date, says the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

Headlines: Accelerated FDA Approval of New Hib Vaccine Boosts Nationwide Supply
Teaser: The FDA has granted accelerated approval for a Haemophilus influenza type b vaccine as a booster dose for children aged 15 months through 4 years.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine: Debate Over Benefits, Marketing, and New Adverse Event Data
Teaser: The benefit of HPV vaccination to prevent cervical cancer is debated, the product's marketing criticized, and new details on postlicensure reports of adverse events revealed in a new issue of JAMA.

Headlines: ACIP Updates Recommendations for Routine Poliovirus Vaccination
Teaser: Updated ACIP recommendations for routine poliovirus vaccination eliminate potential confusion about using different vaccine products for routine and catch-up immunization.

Headlines: Lupus Drugs Dull Flu Shots
Teaser: Immune-suppressing lupus treatments dampen the flu vaccination.

Headlines: CDC Issues H1N1 Vaccination Recommendations
Teaser: In an "urgently" called advisory meeting, the CDC has recommended H1N1 vaccination of pregnant women, all individuals between 6 months and 24 years of age, and high-risk individuals.

Headlines: CDC Recommendation: All Children Should Receive Annual Seasonal Flu Vaccines
Teaser: The CDC upgrades its recommendation from advisement to full recommendation for annual seasonal flu vaccine for all children aged 6 months to 18 years.

Headlines: H1N1 Vaccine Trials in HIV-Positive Pregnant Women and Children to Begin
Teaser: Safety and efficacy testing of the H1N1 vaccine in HIV-positive pregnant women and HIV-positive children will begin this week; trials of the vaccine in patients with asthma are set to launch shortly.

Headlines: HPV Vaccination of Males Not Cost-Effective
Teaser: A new analysis finds that vaccinating boys in addition to girls is unlikely to be cost-effective, compared with vaccinating girls alone.

Headlines: No Loss of Efficacy When H1N1, Seasonal Flu Vaccines Given Simultaneously
Teaser: A report shows that simultaneously administering the H1N1 and seasonal flu vaccines does not lessen either vaccine's efficacy, and 1 dose of the H1N1 vaccine may elicit an adequate immune response.

Headlines: H1N1 Flu Deaths in Children Could Far Surpass Those for Seasonal Flu
Teaser: Deaths among children related to H1N1 flu have already reached 76 at what is normally the beginning of the flu season; pediatric deaths from the past 3 flu seasons have ranged from 46 to 88.

Headlines: Vaccine Reduces Cocaine Use in Patients Reaching Target Antibody Levels
Teaser: Treatment holds promise for other drugs addictions as well.

Headlines: Seasonal Flu Vaccine May Help Protect Against H1N1
Teaser: A case-control study suggests partial protection of seasonal trivalent inactivated vaccine against novel pandemic influenza A (H1N1), but a specific vaccine against H1N1 flu is still needed.

Headlines: CDC Offers Reassurances on H1N1 Vaccine Safety
Teaser: On the second day of nationwide vaccination for the influenza A (H1N1) virus, the director of the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reiterated today that the vaccine is safe in an effort to assuage public misgivings.

Headlines: Cost Effectiveness of Influenza Vaccination
Teaser: Two studies showed that earlier H1N1 vaccination prevented more deaths and that expanded vaccination and antiviral prophylaxis are effective and cost-effective against avian flu pandemic.

Headlines: 25 States, Cities to Receive H1N1 Vaccine by Tuesday
Teaser: Twenty-five states and cities that placed orders for 600,000 doses of a live attenuated (intranasal) vaccine for the influenza A (H1N1) virus will receive their shipments by Tuesday, October 6.

Headlines: Death After Cervarix Propels HPV Vaccination Into Headlines Again
Teaser: Early reports suggest the death of a 14-year-old British girl was not linked to the vaccine, but this is not the first time that deaths after HPV vaccination have made headlines.

Headlines: Vaccines, Hygiene Key to Minimizing H1N1 Spread
Teaser: The vaccine against H1N1 influenza will be available in abundant quantities, more people are getting immunized against influenza than in the past, and the virus's genetic make-up is not changing.

Headlines: Live Attenuated Flu Vaccine May Be Less Effective Than Inactivated Flu Vaccine
Teaser: In the 2007-2008 flu season, the inactivated vaccine was more effective than the live attenuated vaccine in preventing laboratory-confirmed symptomatic influenza A (mostly H3N2) in healthy adults.

Headlines: HIV Vaccine Shows "Modest" Efficacy in Phase 3 Trial
Teaser: A phase 3 study in Thailand demonstrates safety of an HIV vaccine that has 31% efficacy in preventing infection.

Headlines: Updated Recommendations for Use of Hib Booster Vaccine as Supplies Increase
Teaser: The final dose of the Hib booster vaccination series is being given to those children between the age of 15 months and before their fifth birthday who have already received the primary series.

Headlines: Reports of Autoimmune Disorders After HPV Vaccine Raise Questions
Teaser: Investigators have not established a causal relationship between the HPV vaccine and autoimmune disorders, but they are asking clinicians to monitor patients for any emerging adverse effects.

Headlines: Flu Vaccine May Protect Against MI
Teaser: A protective effect was seen in patients with established cardiovascular disease. Whether vaccination is protective in people with no vascular disease is less clear, a new review suggests.

Headlines: New Guidelines Issued for Immunization of Infants, Children, Teens, Adults
Teaser: An Expert Panel of the Infectious Diseases Society of America has prepared these updated, evidence-based guidelines, which replace the previous guidelines published in 2002.

Headlines: New H1N1 Vaccine Works Like Seasonal Flu Vaccine in Children
Teaser: In children aged 10 to 17 years, a single dose of a 2009 H1N1 influenza vaccine generates an immune response that is expected to be protective against the virus.

Headlines: First Doses of H1N1 Vaccine Coming Soon
Teaser: The CDC says 3.4 million doses will be ready in early October.

Headlines: States, Institutions Requiring Flu Shots for Healthcare Workers on the Rise
Teaser: US healthcare workers are increasingly being required to undergo seasonal and H1N1 influenza vaccinations, but the reaction among professionals has not been entirely positive.

Headlines: Vaccine Effective for HPV-Related Vulvar Intraepithelial Neoplasia
Teaser: An experimental vaccine induced a high rate of response in women with human papillomavirus (HPV)-16-positive, high-grade vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia.

Headlines: Vaccines Safe for Children With Inborn Errors of Metabolism
Teaser: A preliminary study found no evidence of serious adverse events, including autism, in children with inborn errors of metabolism who received recommended childhood immunizations.

Headlines: H1N1 Vaccine Supplies Catching Up
Teaser: H1N1 vaccine supplies are now "on track" to meet target levels, according to data reported today at a CDC press briefing.

Headlines: First Group B Streptococcal Vaccine Prevents Colonization
Teaser: A phase 3 study shows, for the first time, the feasibility of immunization against Group B streptococcus infection; an investigational vaccine prevents vaginal colonization.

Headlines: H1N1 Vaccine Protects Pregnant Women
Teaser: One dose of the H1N1 vaccine works for pregnant women, but children still need 2 doses.

Headlines: Shortages of H1N1 Vaccine, Liquid Oseltamivir Continue
Teaser: H1N1 2009 vaccine still in short supply; spot shortages of liquid oseltamivir occurring in some areas.

Headlines: Seasonal Flu Vaccine for Pregnant Mothers Protects Infants
Teaser: Infants born to mothers who were immunized during pregnancy with the seasonal flu vaccine were less likely to be premature, low birthweight, or hospitalized for influenza.

Headlines: Officials: Stay Calm on H1N1 Flu Vaccine
Teaser: The H1N1 vaccine gap is closing, say health and homeland secretaries.

Headlines: Do Yearly Flu Shots for Kids Affect Immunity Against Pandemic Strains?
Teaser: A Lancet Infectious Diseases personal view and comment debate whether yearly vaccinations for children against seasonal flu might stop immunity developing against pandemic strains.

Headlines: Report of Motor Neuron Disease After HPV Vaccine
Teaser: Investigators present a case of rapidly progressive disease leading to the death of a 14-year-old girl.

Headlines: H1N1 Flu Vaccine Arriving -- Slowly
Teaser: Within 2 weeks, the H1N1 swine flu vaccine 'will seem' easier to get, says the CDC.

Headlines: Flu Vaccine Mandate for Healthcare Workers Halted in New York
Teaser: Hundreds of thousands of healthcare workers in New York State are now no longer mandated to be vaccinated against seasonal and H1N1 influenza.Hundreds of thousands of healthcare workers in New York State are now no longer mandated to be vaccinated against seasonal and H1N1 influenza.

Headlines: CDC Will Rely on "Antiquated" H1N1 Vaccine Production Despite Shortage
Teaser: Although disappointed with lower-than-expected supplies of the H1N1 influenza vaccine, the CDC would not switch to newer manufacturing methods, given the relatively mild nature of the pandemic.

Headlines: Quadrivalent HPV Vaccine (Gardasil) Cuts Rates of Genital Warts
Teaser: The incidence of genital warts was markedly reduced in women by the quadrivalent human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine, and a benefit was also seen in heterosexual men.

Headlines: Most Patients With Vaccine Allergy May Be Safely Vaccinated
Teaser: A practice parameter also recommends that patients with suspected allergy to vaccines or vaccine components be evaluated by an allergist or immunologist.

Headlines: FDA Approves Fourth Influenza Shot for Kids
Teaser: The FDA has approved pediatric use of a trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine in children aged 3 to 17 years. The action brings the total number of pediatric seasonal flu vaccines to 4.

Headlines: FDA Approves Cervarix for Cervical Cancer Prevention
Teaser: The FDA has approved a bivalent [recombinant] HPV vaccine for the prevention of cervical cancer and precancers caused by HPV types 16 and 18 in women aged 10 through 25 years.

Headlines: Prophylactic Acetaminophen Before Vaccination in Infants Reduces Vaccine Response
Teaser: A new study shows that the antipyretic acetaminophen may interfere with the efficacy of vaccines and suggests that their use should not be routinely recommended.

Headlines: Thai HIV Vaccine Trial Results Called "Weak"
Teaser: The value of an HIV vaccine in clinical trials in Thailand is questioned after results are described by its own investigators as "weak."

Headlines: Clinical and Psychosocial Burdens of HPV
Teaser: A recent presentation examined the clinical and psychosocial burden and the cost of HPV infection to patients and society.

Headlines: Sanofi Pasteur Recalls 800,000 Doses of Pediatric H1N1 Vaccine
Teaser: H1N1 influenza vaccine prefilled syringes for children aged 6 to 35 months were recalled because of deficient antigen levels; no revaccination is required, but a second dose may be required.

Headlines: H1N1 Vaccine Trial in HIV-Positive Adults Begins Enrollment
Teaser: The NIAID has begun enrolling HIV-positive adults aged 18 to 64 years in a clinical trial of the 2009 H1N1 influenza vaccine to assess its effect on CD4+ T-cell count and immune response.

Headlines: Maternal Immunization During Pregnancy Can Reduce IgE Response in Offspring
Teaser: A new Norwegian study using a mouse model supports the idea that prenatal allergen exposure can reduce the development of childhood allergies.

Headlines: CDC: Few Serious Reactions After Swine Flu Vaccine
Teaser: Chances of neurological disorder seen in 1976 "vanishingly remote."

Headlines: Cervarix Provides Long Duration of Protection Against HPV 16 and 18
Teaser: An extended follow-up study shows that Cervarix generates sustained high levels of neutralizing antibodies against human papillomavirus types 16 and 18 for up to 6.4 years.

Headlines: Phase 2 Clinical Trial of Pediatric Dengue Vaccine Shows Promise
Teaser: Investigational tetravalent vaccine against dengue fever showed immunogenicity and was well tolerated in Filipino children.

Headlines: FDA Approves New Seasonal Influenza Vaccine
Teaser: Accelerated approval of seasonal flu vaccine is expected to enhance US supplies.

Headlines: CDC Warns of Increasing Pneumococcal Disease Associated With H1N1 Flu
Teaser: The CDC is reporting an increase in invasive pneumococcal disease associated with H1N1 influenza, as well as increasing vaccine supplies and no new safety concerns.

Headlines: Seasonal Flu Vaccine May Cut Swine Flu Risk
Teaser: Researchers say seasonal flu provides some cross-immunity against H1N1 swine flu.

Headlines: FDA Expert Panel Declines to Endorse New Influenza Vaccine
Teaser: An advisory committee said more efficacy and safety data are needed before it can back FluBlock, which is made using a new technology.

Headlines: No Adverse Events Reported So Far With H1N1 Influenza Vaccine
Teaser: US officials are keeping a close watch for adverse events from H1N1 influenza vaccinations; nothing has been reported yet, but it's early, and the data are insufficient to assess the safety just yet.

Headlines: H1N1 Vaccine as Safe as Seasonal Vaccine, WHO Says
Teaser: The WHO emphasizes that the pandemic H1N1 influenza vaccine appears to be as safe as the seasonal influenza vaccine, with few reports of adverse events.

Headlines: FDA Panel Recommends Prevnar 13 Vaccine for Approval
Teaser: An advisory committee voted 10 to 1 (with 1 abstention) to approve Pfizer's request for licensure of Prevnar 13 to immunize infants and children against invasive pneumococcal disease.

Headlines: HIV-1 STEP Vaccine Trial Failure Blamed on Adenovirus Shell
Teaser: The increase in HIV infections among vaccines, leading to a halt of the HIV type 1 STEP vaccine trial, has been traced to the adenovirus shell.

Headlines: Less Than Half of College Women Vaccinated Against HPV
Teaser: A new study shows that only 41% of young women in college are vaccinated against human papillomavirus; 30% of unvaccinated women believe the vaccine will "make them sick."

Headlines: FDA Approves Pediatric Use of H1N1 Flu Vaccine
Teaser: CSL Limited has received approval for an expanded indication for its 2009 H1N1 influenza vaccine, allowing the vaccine's use in children 6 months and older in addition to adults.

Headlines: FDA Approves New H1N1 Flu Vaccine
Teaser: The FDA has approved a strain change supplement for an unadjuvanted seasonal influenza vaccine, allowing its modification into a 2009 influenza A (H1N1) pandemic vaccine for use in adults.

Headlines: FDA Commissioner Addresses H1N1 Vaccine Safety Concerns
Teaser: The commissioner of the US Food and Drug Administration reassured healthcare professionals about vaccine safety and thanked them for their "extraordinary efforts" during the H1N1 influenza outbreak.

Headlines: Dutch Pull Pfizer Vaccine Batch After Infants Die
Teaser: Dutch authorities say they have banned use of a batch of Pfizer Inc's (PFE.N) Prevenar, or Prevnar, after three infants died within two weeks of receiving the anti-infection vaccination.

Headlines: Statins Associated With Lower Risk for Death
Teaser: Statin users hospitalized for influenza experienced a 54% lower risk for death than patients not taking statins.

Headlines: Adult Vaccinations Should Be as Widespread as Those for Children
Teaser: Tens of thousands of adults die each year from vaccine-preventable diseases such as seasonal influenza and pneumonia, according to a study.

Headlines: Study Linking Autism to Vaccine Retracted
Teaser: The retraction follows the finding of 'dishonest, irresponsible' study methods.

Headlines: Study Linking Vaccine to Autism Broke Research Rules, U.K. Regulators Say
Teaser: The MMR/autism doctor acted "dishonestly and irresponsibly," a U.K. regulatory panel has ruled.

Headlines: Pentavalent Rotavirus Vaccine May Be Highly Effective Against Severe Disease
Teaser: A case-control study also shows that even partial immunization against severe rotavirus disease confers substantial health benefits.

Headlines: H1N1 2009 Monovalent Vaccination Recommended for Overall Population
Teaser: Now that an ample supply of influenza A (H1N1) vaccine is available, the CDC has expanded the recommendation for vaccination to the rest of the population.

Headlines: Pneumococcal Vaccine Linked to Increase in Serious Lung Complication
Teaser: But children should still be vaccinated against bacterial pneumonia, the researchers say.

Headlines: Personalized Lymphoma Vaccine Is Granted Orphan Drug Status
Teaser: The manufacturer says it is preparing to file for approval on the basis of data that showed an improvement in disease-free survival in lymphoma.

Headlines: Healthcare Costs Slashed When Allergic Children Receive Immunotherapy
Teaser: The cost of prescriptions was also reduced by 16% after immunotherapy initiation in children with allergic rhinitis.

Headlines: Parental Varicella Vaccination Refusal Increases Risk for Unvaccinated Children
Teaser: Unvaccinated children had 9 times the risk for varicella, including medically attended infection, and immunization refusal may decrease herd immunity.

Headlines: IOM Recommends National Strategy for Hepatitis B and C
Teaser: The Institute of Medicine has issued a report recommending a national strategy for the prevention and control of hepatitis B and C viruses, which result in significant mortality.

Headlines: Holiday Uptick in Severe H1N1 Flu
Teaser: Over 60 million got the H1N1 vaccine, and over 75 million more doses are now available.

Headlines: Adult Immunization Schedule for 2010 Issued
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices has issued clinical guidelines for the adult immunization schedule for 2010.

Headlines: Most Healthcare Workers Support Compulsory Influenza Vaccinations
Teaser: Those favoring the mandate more likely to be immunized; some opponents may be swayed by education.

Headlines: Childhood and Adolescent Immunization Schedules Approved for 2010
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics, Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices, and the American Academy of Family Physicians approved new schedules for childhood and adolescent immunization.

Headlines: Another Drugmaker Recalls Swine Flu Vaccine in U.S.
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Tuesday that AstraZeneca's MedImmune unit is voluntarily recalling some of its H1N1 swine flu vaccine because it was not as potent as it should be.

Headlines: FDA Approves High-Dose Seasonal Flu Vaccine for Seniors
Teaser: The FDA has granted accelerated approval for a high-dose seasonal influenza vaccine to prevent disease caused by influenza virus subtypes A and B in people aged 65 years and older.

Headlines: H1N1 Influenza May Increase Maternal Deaths
Teaser: Pregnant women are particularly vulnerable to H1N1 influenza and are at increased risk for severe illness and even death. They should be counseled about the importance of vaccination.

Headlines: One 15-microgram Dose of H1N1 Vaccine May Suffice in Infants and Children
Teaser: In a randomized trial, one 15-microgram dose of vaccine against 2009 influenza A (H1N1) was safe and immunogenic in infants and children 6 months of age or older.

Headlines: H1N1 Vaccine to Be Distributed Soon to Countries That Need It
Teaser: The World Health Organization has identified countries that would have little or no access to the H1N1 influenza vaccine; Azerbaijan, Afghanistan, and Mongolia will soon receive donated vaccine.

Headlines: Single Dose of H1N1 Vaccine Needed for Adults, 2 for Children
Teaser: Three randomized controlled trials suggest that a single dose of H1N1 influenza vaccine should be protective in adults, but that 2 doses are likely needed for children.

Headlines: Rates of US Pandemic Influenza Vaccination Are Lowest in the South
Teaser: Hard-hit Georgia is at the bottom of the list for immunizing children and fifth from the bottom for all individuals.

Headlines: Healthcare Workers Less Often Vaccinated Against H1N1 Than Seasonal Flu
Teaser: Only two thirds of healthcare workers view the pandemic influenza vaccine as safe.

Headlines: Merck to Seek FDA Approval of Gardasil for Men Who Have Sex With Men
Teaser: Gardasil prevents both genital and anal lesions in men who have sex with men, but how effectively does the HPV vaccine prevent precancerous anal lesions?

Headlines: Refusing to Vaccinate Affects Other Kids, Too
Teaser: Vaccine refusal fueled san diego's measles outbreak, according to a study.

Headlines: FDA Temporarily Suspends Use of Rotarix Vaccine
Teaser: Clinicians should stop using the rotavirus vaccine while the agency learns more about components of an extraneous virus detected in the vaccine.

Headlines: FDA Approves Orphan Drug Status for Pancreatic Cancer Vaccine
Teaser: The FDA has approved orphan drug status for a therapeutic vaccine to treat pancreatic cancer.

Headlines: Candidate TB Booster Vaccine Shows Promise in Phase 1 Study
Teaser: The AERAS-402 vaccine was safe and induced a robust and durable immune response in BCG-primed healthy Mycobacterium tuberculosis-uninfected adults from South Africa.

Headlines: CDC Concerned About Spike in Mumps Cases in NY/NJ Hasidic Community
Teaser: An ongoing outbreak of mumps in the Hasidic (Jewish) community in New York and New Jersey prompted the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to issue a Health Advisory this week.

Headlines: Complete HPV Immunization Rates Low in the United States
Teaser: Only 11% of adolescents aged 13 to 17 years receive all 3 doses of the human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine, according to a new CDC investigation.

Headlines: Immunizing Children and Teenagers May Protect Entire Community From Influenza
Teaser: Study opens up possibility of new strategy in "herd immunity."

Headlines: Conjugate Vaccine Prevents Recurrent Pneumococcal Disease in HIV
Teaser: The 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine cuts the risk of recurrent invasive Streptococcus pneumoniae infection in HIV patients, according to a study from Malawi.

Headlines: Survey Shows Parents Worry About Vaccines
Teaser: Most parents vaccinate their kids, but many still worry about the side effects of vaccines.

Headlines: Thai HIV Vaccine: Transient Effects, Protection for Those at Low Risk
Teaser: Post hoc analyses show that the effects of the Thai HIV vaccine in the RV 144 trial last for about a year, and it might be most effective for those at low risk.

Headlines: CDC Advisory Committee Recommends Universal Influenza Vaccination
Teaser: All people aged 6 months and older should receive an annual influenza vaccine beginning next flu season (2010-2011), a federal panel of immunization experts says.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Panel Recommends Including H1N1 in Next Seasonal Flu Vaccine
Teaser: If the FDA follows the panel's recommendation, it would eliminate the cumbersome 2-vaccine regimen now in place.

Headlines: Pandemic H1N1 Virus Should Be Added to 2010-2011 Seasonal Flu Vaccine, Says WHO
Teaser: National public health authorities will decide whether pandemic virus should be included in the traditional trivalent vaccine or given separately.

Headlines: Study Does Not Support HPV Vaccine in Older Women
Teaser: A new natural-history study of human papillomavirus (HPV) looks at age, persistence of infection, and cervical cancer precursors.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Reduces Rates of Genital Diseases in Young Women
Teaser: The quadrivalent human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine (Gardasil) significantly reduces HPV-associated genital diseases such as warts and cervical dysplasia.

Headlines: Longer Needle May Be Preferred for HBV Vaccination of Obese Teens
Teaser: In a randomized study, use of a longer needle resulted in significantly higher titers in response to hepatitis B virus vaccine among obese adolescents.

Headlines: Results of US Health-Risk Surveillance System Reported
Teaser: Controlling health-risk behaviors and using preventive health-care services can reduce or prevent morbidity and premature mortality from chronic diseases.

Headlines: Two Cancer Researchers Among the 100 "Most Influential People in World"
Teaser: Cancer vaccine researchers Larry Kwak and Doug Schwartzentruber were named by TIME magazine as being among the 100 most influential people in the world.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Trials Show Long-Term Protection Against Abnormal Cytology
Teaser: Two different clinical trials on the HPV vaccine Cervarix have shown protection against HPV 16 and 18 after 7 years and a decreased incidence of abnormal cytology for sexually active women.

Headlines: Breast-Feeding Linked to Lower Incidence of Fever After Immunizations
Teaser: An Italian prospective cohort study shows that breast-feeding is associated with a decreased incidence of fever after immunizations.

Headlines: Rotarix or RotaTeq Vaccination May Be Effective, Safe in Childhood
Teaser: A Cochrane review shows that Rotarix or RotaTeq significantly protects against severe rotavirus diarrhea and hospitalizations without increased serious adverse events.

Headlines: Coadministration of Gardasil With Menactra, Adacel May Be Safe, Immunogenic
Teaser: A study shows that coadministration of these vaccines recommended by the ACIP for routine vaccination of adolescents does not reduce safety, tolerability, and immunogenicity.

Headlines: FDA Says Use of Rotarix Should Resume
Teaser: Based on a review of available data, the FDA has reversed its recommendation to temporarily suspend use of Rotarix.

Headlines: ACIP Issues New Guidelines for Use of Combination MMRV Vaccine
Teaser: A MMWR report offers new recommendations for use of the MMRV vaccine adopted in June 2009 by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices.

Headlines: HIV Vaccine Secret Found in 'Elite Controllers'
Teaser: A genetic mutation allows some people to never get AIDS.

Headlines: Benefits of Contaminated Rotavirus Vaccine Outweigh Risks, Says FDA Panel
Teaser: However, committee members recommend further studies on possible long-term risks.

Headlines: HIV Vaccine Research a Field Apart From Classic Vaccinology
Teaser: Protective immunity against HIV doesn't appear to occur, causing researchers to shift away from developing a vaccine that protects against infection to one that is less lethal and perhaps even benign.

Headlines: Fusion Protein May Enhance Efficacy of Influenza Vaccine
Teaser: Combining a recombinant fusion protein of the influenza ectodomain with a TLR5 ligand of Salmonella typhimurium increases the immune response to the influenza A components of TIV by 50%.

Headlines: Pertussis Vaccination Triggers Dravet Syndrome in Predisposed Children
Teaser: Pertussis vaccination may trigger earlier onset of Dravet syndrome in some children predisposed to develop the disease, but this does not affect their clinical outcome.

Headlines: Pandemic Flu and Vaccine Development
Teaser: A presentation at NAPNAP's annual meeting described the most current information related to the flu pandemic and development processes for the H1N1 vaccines.

Headlines: Canadian Surveillance Studies Help to Understand H1N1 Patterns
Teaser: The 2008/09 seasonal influenza vaccine roughly doubles the risk for H1N1 infection; a vaccine that induces nonneutralizing or subneutralizing concentrations of antibody can enhance the infection.

Headlines: Herpes Zoster Vaccine Is Safe, but Financial and Other Barriers Limit Its Use
Teaser: Herpes zoster vaccine is safe in older, immunocompetent adults, but financial and other barriers hinder physicians' efforts to provide this vaccine.

Headlines: Neonatal Vitamin A Supplementation and Response to Pediatric Vaccination
Teaser: Vitamin A supplementation in children between 6 months and 5 years was associated with excess female mortality, particularly when diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis vaccine was the most recent vaccine.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccination May Not Affect INR Values or Warfarin Dosing
Teaser: A study shows that influenza vaccination has no significant effect on international normalized ratio values or weekly doses of warfarin sodium.

Headlines: Reports of Guillain-Barré Syndrome Low After 2009 H1N1 Vaccination
Teaser: New numbers from the CDC/FDA Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System suggest that cases of GBS are low, but investigators stress that passive surveillance generally underestimates the risk.

Headlines: Flu Shot Without Skin Testing May Be Safe for Egg-Allergic Patients
Teaser: A study suggests that patients without anaphylaxis to egg may safely receive the influenza vaccine in a 2-dose, graded fashion without a vaccine skin test.

Headlines: Early-Life Infections, Immunizations Alter Childhood Asthma Risk
Teaser: Combined diphtheria and tetanus immunization in the first year may be a risk factor for asthma, but the need for immunization may also be a marker of increased risk for asthma in later childhood.

Headlines: CDC: Adolescent Vaccinations Increased Substantially From 2008 to 2009
Teaser: Vaccination coverage among adolescents aged 13 to 17 years increased from 2008 to 2009, although considerable variability exists among states; there is still room for improvement, particularly against pertussis.

Headlines: Live Oral Pentavalent Rotavirus Vaccine May Be Safe, Effective in Developing Countries
Teaser: Randomized controlled trials in Asia and Africa show that this rotavirus vaccine is as safe and effective for preventing severe rotavirus as it is in middle-high income nations.

Headlines: NIH Launches Phase 1 Dengue Vaccine Trial
Teaser: The National Institutes of Health (NIH) has launched the first clinical trial of a dengue virus vaccine at Johns Hopkins University.

Headlines: Pediatric Virologist Robert Chanock Dead at 86
Teaser: His discoveries of childhood respiratory viruses led to the development of several important vaccines.

Headlines: H1N1 Vaccine Has Shorter Shelf Life Than Indicated
Teaser: Influenza A (H1N1) 2009 monovalent vaccine manufactured in 2009 in multidose vials will have a shorter expiration period than indicated on the label.

Headlines: Physicians Avoid Recommending HPV Vaccine in Girls Aged 11 to 12 Years
Teaser: According to a new survey, US physicians appear to be reluctant to offer the human papillomavirus vaccine to girls aged 11 to 12 years, as recommended in national guidelines.

Headlines: ACIP Updates Guidelines for Prevention and Control of Influenza With Vaccines
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices has issued new 2010 recommendations for prevention and control of influenza with vaccines.

Headlines: Fevers, Febrile Seizures Higher After Afluria Vaccination in Children Below Equator
Teaser: The seasonal influenza vaccine Afluria contains a strain of the pandemic 2009 H1N1 virus.

Headlines: FDA Approves Flu Shot With H1N1 Protection for 2010-2011 Season
Teaser: The FDA has approved vaccines for the 2010 to 2011 flu season that protect against 3 strains of influenza, including the 2009 H1N1 pandemic swine flu virus.

Headlines: Strategy for H1N1 Vaccine Delivery in Skokie, Illinois, Improved Access
Teaser: With H1N1 vaccine shortages reported at the end of 2009, the Skokie Health Department successfully vaccinated residents and high-priority nonresidents to maximize the number of vaccinations given.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine May Offer Protection Against Genital Warts, Precancerous Growths
Teaser: In 2 randomized controlled trials, human papillomavirus vaccine gave prolonged protection against genital warts and low-grade precancerous growths.

Headlines: Gates Lays Out Approach to Reducing Financial Impact of AIDS Epidemic
Teaser: Bill Gates presented a plan to reduce the AIDS epidemic with more prevention, reduction of treatment costs, improved delivery of care, and more-efficient approaches to vaccine trials.

Headlines: Antibodies Induced by HIV Vaccines May Give False-Positive HIV Test Results
Teaser: Vaccines in development against HIV might induce antibodies that cause false-positive results on HIV testing. Trial subjects need to inform their healthcare providers that they have been in a trial.

Headlines: Animal Study Shows Potential of Universal Influenza Vaccine
Teaser: A primer dose followed by a periodic booster could eliminate the need for annual influenza vaccinations.

Headlines: Tdap Vaccine Protects Against Pertussis During Outbreak
Teaser: The Tdap vaccine (a tetanus, reduced-dose diphtheria, and acellular pertussis booster) effectively protected adolescents during a pertussis outbreak in the US Virgin Islands in 2007.

Headlines: California Promotes Adult Vaccination to Combat Pertussis Epidemic
Teaser: Other states are reporting more cases of whooping cough than usual, although the nation as a whole is experiencing less disease activity.

Headlines: MMRV Doubles Risk for Febrile Seizures 7 to 10 Days After Vaccination
Teaser: A new study suggests the vaccine causes 1 additional seizure for every 2300 doses with the combination vaccine, so the risk is still low, researchers note.

Headlines: ACIP Votes to Change Recommendations for Meningococcal, Flu Vaccines
Teaser: The committee recommended changes to warnings about the risk for Guillain-Barre syndrome after meningococcal vaccination, and also a change in dosing for children who receive the seasonal influenza vaccine.

Headlines: Split-Virus H1N1 Vaccine Offers Children More Immunity Than Whole-Virus Version
Teaser: Higher incidence of reactions including pain, soreness, and headache after split-virus vaccine is not alarming.

Headlines: Delaying or Forgoing Childhood Vaccines Offers No Neuropsychological Benefit Down the Road
Teaser: A new study should quell fears of parents that infants have "immune overload" from early vaccinations.

Headlines: ACIP Recommends Meningococcal Booster Dose
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices has voted in favor of a second meningococcal vaccine dose given within 5 years of the first dose.

Headlines: H1N1 Influenza Vaccine Safe for Pregnant Women
Teaser: Pregnant women receiving the H1N1 flu vaccine had no more adverse effects than unvaccinated women, except for arm soreness. Obstetrical providers' recommendation was a strong driver of vaccination.

Headlines: Secondhand Smoke and Hospitalization Risk in Young Children With Influenza
Teaser: Secondhand smoke, a young mother, and comorbidities raise the risk for hospitalization in young children with influenza; vaccination of household members halved the risk.

Headlines: Kids at High Risk for Severe Illness, Death Should Get Flu Vaccination Priority
Teaser: In a UK study, children at highest risk for influenza-related complications were ethnic minorities and those with specified preexisting disorders.

Headlines: Hepatitis B Virus Immunity Often Compromised in Children on Biologics
Teaser: Despite vaccinations, children receiving infliximab often have inadequate immunity against hepatitis B virus infection.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccine Preference, Uptake in Older People Reviewed
Teaser: A review of influenza vaccine preference and uptake among older people in 9 countries may help guide strategies for better vaccine access and compliance in older people.

Headlines: Flu Shots OK for People With Egg Allergy
Teaser: The American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology says a few have reactions to the flu vaccine.

Headlines: Most Physicians Plan to Get Influenza Vaccine
Teaser: The survey of 400 primary care physicians, including 100 pediatricians, found that 95% say they have been or plan to get vaccinated against seasonal influenza this year.

Headlines: Maternal Influenza Vaccination May Protect Infants From Flu
Teaser: Maternal influenza vaccination was significantly associated with reduced risk for influenza infection and hospitalization in infants up to 6 months of age.

Headlines: Rotarix Label Has New Warning About Risk for Bowel Abnormality
Teaser: The increased risk for intussusception was the reason that a different rotavirus vaccine was withdrawn from the market in 1999.

Headlines: ACOG Guidelines Recommend Influenza Vaccination During Pregnancy
Teaser: The updated ACOG position statement calls for unvaccinated pregnant women to be immunized at any time during the influenza season, and preferably early.

Headlines: Flu Vaccine Cuts MI Risk by 20%
Teaser: A new case-control study has found that influenza vaccination seemed to reduce the risk of a first heart attack by about a fifth, but pneumococcal immunization had no effect on the risk.

Headlines: Pneumococcal Vaccine Dosing Schedule Linked to Higher Risk for Multiresistant Strain
Teaser: Compared with unvaccinated control subjects, patients given a 2 + 1-dose 7-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccination schedule had an increase in serotype 19A nasopharyngeal acquisition.

Headlines: Further Evidence Shows No Link Between Thimerosal and Increased Autism Risk
Teaser: A case-control study finds no evidence that increasing thimerosal exposure is associated with increased risk of autism outcomes.

Headlines: Pneumococcal Vaccine in Childhood Does Not Reduce Adult Hospitalizations
Teaser: A 2004 government vaccine program for children failed to have an impact on adult hospitalizations for pneumonia over the subsequent 3 years, according to a Canadian study.

Headlines: Guidelines Updated for 23-Valent Pneumococcal Polysaccharide Vaccine in Adults
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices has updated recommendations for prevention of invasive pneumococcal disease among adults using the 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine.

Headlines: Mandate Flu Vaccination for Healthcare Workers, Say Infectious Disease Experts
Teaser: Required vaccination at several healthcare organizations has boosted their workforce immunization rates past the 98% mark, according to a position paper from the Society for Healthcare Epidemiology of America.

Headlines: CDC No Longer Recommends Delaying Influenza Vaccination for Elderly
Teaser: A CDC official says there is no evidence that elderly patients gain more protection against influenza by waiting until October or November to get immunized.

Headlines: Guidelines for Influenza Vaccination and Antiviral Therapy in Children
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics has updated guidelines for use of trivalent seasonal influenza vaccine and antiviral medications to prevent and treat influenza in children.

Headlines: New Vaccine Prevents Hepatitis E Virus Infection in Healthy Adults in China
Teaser: A recombinant vaccine prevents hepatitis E virus infection in healthy adults, according to new study from China.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccine Supply Affects Racial and Ethnic Disparities in the Elderly
Teaser: Improved supply reduces vaccination rate discrepancy for Hispanic and black Medicare patients.

Headlines: Gardasil Gets FDA Nod for Prevention of Anal Cancer
Teaser: Already approved for the prevention of cervical, vulvar, and vaginal cancer, Gardasil is now approved for the prevention of anal cancer by the FDA in human papillomavirus types 6, 11, 16, and 18.

Headlines: 2009 H1N1 Vaccine Safe, Immunogenic in Persons With Asthma
Teaser: In an NIH-sponsored open-label trial, the 2009 H1N1 vaccine was safe and induced a robust immune response in people with asthma.

Headlines: Financial Barriers Lower Pediatric Use of Combination Vaccines
Teaser: New survey shows 1 in 5 pediatricians cite inadequate payment as the reason for not administering 1 or more combination vaccines.

Headlines: CDC Recommends Flu Vaccine for Everyone Aged 6 Months and Older
Teaser: This week is National Influenza Vaccination Week, and the CDC is emphasizing the importance of influenza vaccination for everyone aged 6 months and older.

Headlines: Jump in Influenza Immunization Rates Among Pregnant Women
Teaser: Health officials say several factors helped boost seasonal and H1N1 influenza vaccination coverage rates among pregnant women in the 2009 to 2010 season.

Headlines: Many US Adults Still at Risk for Vaccine-Preventable Illnesses
Teaser: Physician-patient communication gaps may result in lower immunization rates.

Headlines: Trivalent Inactivated Influenza Vaccine May Prevent Influenza in Children Younger Than 2 Years
Teaser: Because trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine effectively prevents influenza in young children, including those younger than 2 years, countries should reassess influenza vaccine recommendations.

Headlines: FDA Panel Recommends HPV Vaccine for Anal Cancer Prevention
Teaser: The advisory panel voted in favor of expanding the indication of quadrivalent human papillomavirus recombinant vaccine for preventing anal cancer in young adults.

Headlines: Text Messaging Improves Compliance With Therapy
Teaser: New studies from the United States and Kenya show that text messaging is a simple, effective way to improve vaccination rates and HIV therapy adherence.

Headlines: Intervention to Reduce Pain, Anxiety of Immunization Feasible in Pediatric Practices
Teaser: After 1 hour training on techniques to reduce the pain and anxiety associated with immunization, pediatric practices continued using the techniques at 6 months.

Headlines: HPV Vaccination of Young Women May Protect Men Through Herd Immunity
Teaser: High coverage of HPV vaccination in young Australian women resulted in lower frequency of genital warts, which might protect heterosexual men through herd immunity.

Headlines: Malaria Vaccine Safe and Effective in Infants
Teaser: A malaria vaccine candidate, RTS,S/AS01E, the furthest along in clinical development, demonstrated safety and efficacy in a phase 2 trial of infants.

Headlines: Most HPV Vaccinations Not Completed in Urban Study
Teaser: Young adults are the age group least likely to complete the 3-dose vaccination course for human papillomavirus (HPV).

Headlines: Therapeutic HCV Vaccine Opens Door to Potential Treatment Option
Teaser: A therapeutic vaccine to treat hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection has demonstrated proof of principle that the concept can work, but efficacy remains an issue.

Headlines: Training Needed for US Doctors Providing International Travel Advice
Teaser: A survey of primary care providers and specialists in the United States indicates that travel medicine training is needed, particularly among those who see fewer travelers.

Headlines: Hospital Reaches Near 100% Flu Vaccination Rate of Staff With Mandate
Teaser: A tertiary care hospital has consistently achieved greater than a 98% flu vaccination rate among staff using a mandate. Less than 1% of staff opted out for medical or religious reasons.

Headlines: Accelerating HBV Vaccine Boosts Adherence for IDUs
Teaser: Accelerating the hepatitis B virus (HBV) vaccination schedule can increase the number of injection drug users (IDUs) who receive all three doses, new research shows.

Headlines: CDC Panel Recommends Changes to 2011 Immunization Schedules
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices approved changes to both the child and adult 2011 immunization charts.

Headlines: ACIP Now Recommends Tdap Vaccine at Age 65 Years and Older
Teaser: ACIP has recommended a booster vaccination with the Tdap vaccine in people between the ages of 11 and 64 years and for those older than 65 years if they come in close contact with infants.

Headlines: ACIP Revises Language for Tdap Vaccination of Healthcare Workers
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices has additional specific guidelines for Tdap vaccine use in healthcare personnel; it also recommends postexposure prophylaxis for tetanus, diphtheria, and pertussis.

Headlines: Rapid Flu Vaccine Development Method as Effective as Current Method
Teaser: Researchers develop a faster method for developing influenza vaccine using cell culture, rather than embryonated hens' eggs.

Headlines: National Plan Gives Shot in the Arm to Immunization Efforts
Teaser: The US Department of Health and Human Services has unveiled a 10-year strategy to boost vaccine accessibility.

Headlines: Public, Physicians Paying More Attention to Flu Shots
Teaser: Hot on the heels of the H1N1 influenza pandemic, new research suggests physicians and the public seem to be getting the message about the importance of universal influenza vaccination.

Headlines: Old Influenza Vaccines Can Boost New Ones
Teaser: Antigenically out-of-date influenza vaccines act as effective boosters for contemporary antigen vaccines.

Headlines: New Smallpox Vaccine Protects People With Atopic Dermatitis
Teaser: A vaccine currently in development might be suitable for patients with atopic dermatitis who are currently excluded from vaccination with traditional smallpox vaccines.

Headlines: Risk for Local Reaction to Fifth Dose of DTap Vaccine Higher With Arm Injection
Teaser: Risk for a local reaction to the fifth dose of the diphtheria and tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine is significantly higher when it is injected in the arm.

Headlines: Some Vaccines Might Protect Kids Against Leukemia
Teaser: Kids who have had certain vaccines might be less likely to develop cancer, especially one type of leukemia, suggests a new study.

Headlines: Quadrivalent HPV Vaccine May Be Effective in Young Men
Teaser: Quadrivalent human papillomavirus vaccine may prevent infection with HPV types 6, 11, 16, and 18 and the development of related external genital lesions in young men 16 to 26 years old.

Headlines: AAP Issues Recommended Childhood and Teen Immunization Schedules
Teaser: The 2011 recommended childhood and adolescent immunization schedules have been released by the American Academy of Pediatrics and approved by several other organizations.

Headlines: Adult Immunization Schedule for 2011 Released
Teaser: Changes in the 2011 adult immunization schedule include a permissive recommendation for use of the tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis vaccine in adults 65 years or older.

Headlines: Recommendations on Use of Meningococcal Conjugate Vaccines Updated
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices has updated its recommendations for use of meningococcal conjugate vaccines.

Headlines: Hispanic Seniors Have Lower Immunization Rates Than Non-Hispanic Whites
Teaser: Hispanic seniors continue to be immunized at markedly lower rates than non-Hispanic whites, even after adjustment for health and sociodemographics.

Headlines: FDA/CDC to Study Increase in Febrile Seizures After Flu Vaccination
Teaser: The seizures have occurred mostly in children younger than 2 years. Nearly all children experiencing febrile seizures quickly recover with no lasting aftereffects, the FDA notes.

Headlines: Medical Establishment Buried Concerns About MMR/Autism Study, BMJ Charges
Teaser: In the last of 3 articles, BMJ reports the medical community "scrambled" to discredit concerns and failed to investigate allegations raised about a study linking the MMR vaccine to regressive autism.

Headlines: ACIP Updates Guidelines for Use of Tdap Vaccine
Teaser: Vaccination with tetanus toxoid, reduced diphtheria toxoid, and acellular pertussis is the best way for adolescents and adults to protect themselves and others against pertussis, with a 1-time dose.

Headlines: Investigator Planned to Make Vast Profit From Autism/MMR Vaccine Scare, BMJ Says
Teaser: BMJ reports that Andrew Wakefield, who led the study in 1998 linking the MMR vaccine to autism, planned several business ventures to take advantage of an eventual vaccine scare.

Headlines: Herpes Zoster Vaccine Reduces Zoster Risk by Half
Teaser: A new community-based study confirms that vaccination of adults older than 60 years with the herpes zoster vaccine reduced subsequent herpes zoster cases by about 50%.

Headlines: Varicella Vaccination Reduces Hospitalizations
Teaser: Varicella-related hospitalizations have declined by more than 65% in all age groups since the vaccine program began.

Headlines: Vaccine Blocks Cocaine High, Animal Study Shows
Teaser: Scientists have developed a vaccine strategy that makes mice immune to the exhilarating effects of cocaine.

Headlines: Experimental AIDS Vaccine Shows Promise in Monkeys
Teaser: An experimental vaccine helped control a form of the AIDS virus in monkeys for more than a year, suggesting it may lead to a vaccine for people, U.S. researchers said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Zoster and Pneumococcal Vaccines May Be Given Concomitantly
Teaser: Giving pneumococcal and herpes zoster vaccines to patients during the same visit may be beneficial without compromising the protective effect of the zoster vaccine.

Headlines: Trial of HIV-1 Vaccine in South Africa Shows No Benefit
Teaser: In a South African trial, an HIV-1 vaccine did not prevent HIV-1 infection or lower viral-load setpoint, but early trial termination may have limited power to draw conclusions.

Headlines: Vaccine Critics Claim Court Paid for Autism Cases
Teaser: The study reports that 83 cases of vaccine-caused brain damage receiving federal compensation involved autism. Experts reply that shared symptoms do not make brain damage and autism identical.

Headlines: Accelerated Hepatitis B Vaccination Schedule Has Benefits in Pregnancy
Teaser: Results of a prospective clinical trial show that an accelerated hepatitis B vaccination schedule at 0, 1, and 4 months in high-risk pregnant women is effective, practical, and well tolerated.

Headlines: Merck, Qiagen Donate HPV Tests, Vaccines to Rwanda
Teaser: U.S. drugmaker Merck and German diagnostics firm Qiagen are donating millions of human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccines and 250,000 HPV tests to Rwanda to start a national cervical cancer prevention program.

Headlines: FDA Approves Menactra for Vaccinating Infants, Toddlers
Teaser: Menactra already is approved for use in people age 2 through 55 years.

Headlines: Vaccine Made of Glioblastoma Lysate Prolongs Survival
Teaser: A vaccine of dendritic cells pulsed with a lysate of glioblastoma cells prolonged overall survival compared with dendritic cells pulsed with a mixture of specific glioblastoma peptide antigens.

Headlines: Parents' Vaccine Safety Concerns Dominate Office Visits
Teaser: Parental safety concerns about vaccines are taking up a growing proportion of physicians' time, according to a new study.

Headlines: Four-Dose HBV Vaccine Regimen Preferred in Adults with HIV-1
Teaser: In adults with HIV-1, both the 4 intramuscular double-dose regimen and the 4 intradermal low-dose regimen improved serologic response vs the standard hepatitis B virus vaccine regimen.

Headlines: Alternative Dosing Schedules for HPV Vaccine May Increase Use
Teaser: Lengthening the time between doses of the HPV vaccine from 2 months to 3 or 6 months was found to be noninferior to standard dosing in a randomized study.

Headlines: 2009 A/H1N1 Flu Vaccine Immunogenic Even in Preterm Children
Teaser: A single dose of 2009 pandemic A/H1N1 MF59-adjuvanted influenza vaccine was immunogenic in preterm and term children aged 6 to 23 months and could be considered protective.

Headlines: AAP Endorses CDC's Rabies Vaccine Dose Regimen
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices recommends lowering the number of doses from 5 to 4 of human diploid cell vaccine or purified chick embryo cell vaccine to prevent human rabies.

Headlines: FDA Approves Zoster Vaccine for Younger Adults
Teaser: The vaccine is already approved for those 60 and older, and the FDA has now approved it for those age 50 to 59 years.

Headlines: Japan Panel Finds No Link to Vaccine Deaths: Kyodo
Teaser: A panel of experts at Japan's health ministry found no direct link between vaccines made by Pfizer Inc and Sanofi-Aventis SA and the deaths of children, but said further checks were needed, Kyodo news agency reported on Tuesday.

Headlines: Japan Halts Prevenar, ActHIB Vaccines After Four Children Die
Teaser: Japan's health ministry has halted the use of vaccines made by Pfizer Inc and Sanofi-Aventis SA to prevent meningitis and pneumonia following the deaths of four children.

Headlines: FDA Panel Keeps Same Formulation for 2011-12 Influenza Vaccine
Teaser: The Vaccine and Related Biologic Products Advisory Committee decided to stick with the current formulation, but not without trepidation.

Headlines: Coadministration of Flu, Pneumococcal Vaccines Linked to Febrile Seizures
Teaser: CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP) discusses febrile seizures associated with vaccine use.

Headlines: ACIP Reviews Upcoming Vaccine Shortages
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices provides update on vaccine supply in the coming months.

Headlines: High Court Protects Vaccine Makers for 'Unavoidable' Adverse Events
Teaser: Parents still have recourse through the federally mandated "Vaccine Court."

Headlines: Vacc-4x Reduces Viral Load in HIV Patients Off ART
Teaser: The peptide-based therapeutic vaccine Vacc-4x appears to reduce viral load in patients with HIV who maintain viral suppression without antiretroviral therapy (ART) for 6 months.

Headlines: Preterm Infants May Receive 10-Valent Pneumococcal Vaccine
Teaser: The 10-valent pneumococcal nontypeable Haemophilus influenzae protein D conjugate vaccine (PHiD-CV) was well tolerated and immunogenic in preterm infants when given as a 3-dose primary vaccination.

Headlines: Two Full Doses of Flu Vaccine May Improve Infant Immunity
Teaser: Administration of 2 full trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine doses to infants may enhance immunogenicity without increasing reactogenicity.

Headlines: Flu Vaccines for 2011-2012 Season Receive FDA Approval
Teaser: The FDA has approved a trivalent formulation of the influenza vaccine for the 2011 to 2012 influenza season.

Headlines: H1N1 Flu Vaccine Not Linked to Guillain-Barré Syndrome
Teaser: In a case-control study, the risk for Guillain-Barré syndrome was not increased after pandemic influenza vaccine, but the upper limit did not exclude a potential increase in risk up to 2.7-fold.

Headlines: FDA Approves Tdap Booster for Seniors
Teaser: The tetanus, diphtheria, and acellular pertussis (Tdap) booster vaccine marketed as Boostrix has received expanded approval to include adults aged 65 and older.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccination During Pregnancy May Protect Newborns
Teaser: Infants of vaccinated mothers were 45% to 48% less likely to have influenza hospitalizations than infants of unvaccinated mothers, supporting the current vaccination recommendation for pregnant women.

Headlines: New Meningitis Shot Could Halt African Epidemics
Teaser: A cheap new meningitis vaccine designed to treat a type of the disease common in Africa could significantly reduce or even halt future epidemics in Africa's so-called "meningitis belt," scientists said in the June 16th New England Journal of Medicine.

Headlines: Sleep Quality, Not Duration, Affects Vaccination Response
Teaser: Insomniacs had better response than good sleepers, but short-wave sleep was key.

Headlines: Hep A Vaccine Response Persists in Well-Controlled HIV
Teaser: Hepatitis A vaccine immunity persists for long durations in patients with well-controlled HIV, new research shows.

Headlines: Mixed Feelings About Vaccines Among Parents
Teaser: Immunization rates for most childhood diseases are high, but most parents express concerns about vaccines.

Headlines: Flu Vaccine Rates Are High for 2 Seasons in a Row
Teaser: The CDC says vaccine rates are still short of the government's long-term goals.

Headlines: Middle-Income Countries May Lag in New Decade of Vaccines
Teaser: Governments and health authorities are increasingly facing the daunting challenge of coming up with novel ways to finance access to new vaccines.

Headlines: Communication Needed to Foster Vaccine Acceptance
Teaser: Flagging public confidence in the immunization community should be addressed by research into the social and psychological factors that contribute to it.

Headlines: Lancet Study Focuses on Readiness for Influenza Pandemic
Teaser: The third paper in a Lancet series highlights factors that affect vaccine production, access, and uptake, and focuses on the influenza vaccine as an example.

Headlines: 'Decade of Vaccines' Will Save Lives and Money Globally
Teaser: Vaccines are projected to save the lives of more than 6 million children and spare an estimated $231 billion in treatment and related costs in the next decade, according an analysis of the "Decade of Vaccines" project.

Headlines: Children With Asthma at High Risk for Flu Complications
Teaser: The authors of a new analysis call for increased efforts to encourage influenza vaccination for children with asthma.

Headlines: Vaccines: Not Just for Babies
Teaser: Learn more about meeting the immunization needs of teens and adults.

Headlines: Healthcare Workers Choose Flu Shots Over Masks
Teaser: Vaccination rates increased from 90.5% to 96.0% after a policy was implemented to force healthcare workers to accept vaccination or sign a declination and wear a mask.

Headlines: Effectiveness of DTaP Wanes Substantially Over Time
Teaser: Each year that elapses after diphtheria, tetanus, acellular pertussis vaccination (DTaP) is associated with a 36% increased risk of acquiring pertussis, a new study shows.

Headlines: HPV Vaccines Differ in Cost-Effectiveness and Cancer Deaths
Teaser: The 2 human papilloma virus vaccines available each have distinct benefits in terms of cost and protection against death from HPV-related cancers, according to a new mathematical modeling study.

Headlines: Close Contacts of International Adoptees Need Hep A Vaccine
Teaser: The guidelines for hepatitis A vaccination related to international adoptions have been expanded.

Headlines: AAP Updates Polio Vaccine Recommendations
Teaser: If a child is at imminent risk for exposure, with planned travel to certain countries, the AAP  recommends that the IPV doses be administered at minimum ages and intervals.

Headlines: Most Pneumococcal Isolates Are Not Covered by Vaccines
Teaser: Pediatric vaccines against Streptococcus pneumoniae lessened the overall incidence of pneumonia serotypes, even though most current isolates are serotypes not covered by the 13-valent vaccine.

Headlines: Pertussis Vaccine May Not Give Long-Term Protection
Teaser: A study suggests protection from the vaccine may lessen after 3 years.

Headlines: Needle-Free Shots Make Vaccines Less Scary
Teaser: Alternatives to traditional vaccinations appeal to patients who don't like needles.

Headlines: Clinicians Increasingly Recommend Flu Vaccine, But More to Do
Teaser: About one third of patients surveyed indicate they will not get the influenza vaccine this season, according to a new survey from the National Foundation for Infectious Diseases.

Headlines: Expanding Flu Shots to Older Kids Cuts Flu ER Visits
Teaser: Vaccination of older children is associated with a population-wide reduction in ER visits for flu-related symptoms.

Headlines: Bioethicists Offer $11,000 for Proof of HPV Vaccine Story
Teaser: A pair of bioethicists have challenged Congresswoman Michele Bachmann to provide evidence that vaccination for HPV causes mental retardation.

Headlines: Malaria Vaccine Selectively Effective
Teaser: A malaria vaccine based on 1 strain of the disease has little overall effect, but was active against the strain from which it was produced.

Headlines: Two Doses of HPV Vaccine May Be Enough for Protection
Teaser: Fewer than the recommended 3 doses of bivalent human papilloma virus (HPV)16/18 vaccine still show efficacy against infection with high-risk HPV16 and HPV18.

Headlines: CDC: HPV Vaccination Rates Too Low
Teaser: Data from the CDC indicate that rates for vaccinations in teenagers are increasing, but rates for the HPV series have increased the least and may fall short of national goals.

Headlines: Few Adverse Events Linked to Vaccines, IOM Panel Says
Teaser: The expert committee also reported that scientific evidence favors rejecting a causal relationship between autism and the measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Protects Against Anal Infection in Women
Teaser: Cervarix does double duty but how long does the protection last?

Headlines: Flu Shots Plateau for Health Workers, Rise for Physicians
Teaser: The vaccination rate for seasonal influenza in 2010-2011 among healthcare personnel still falls considerably short of the 90% target set by the federal government for this group.

Headlines: Updated Influenza Vaccine Recommendations Issued
Teaser: US health officials have released updated guidance on the use of the influenza vaccine in the United States for the 2011-2012 season.

Headlines: Study Finds Promise for Caries Immunization
Teaser: Drug company researchers say lozenges containing a chicken antibody can selectively control Streptococcus mutans.

Headlines: HIV Vaccine Study Goal Shifts to HIV Prevention
Teaser: Scope, enrollment of the NIH study expanding amid promising evidence of vaccine's protection.

Headlines: Study Confirms Safety of Pediatric Flu Vaccine
Teaser: Analysis shows only minor, expected reactions in children aged 24 to 59 months.

Headlines: Parental Fears Over Childhood Vaccination Must Be Addressed
Teaser: Although the rate of childhood vaccination refusal by parents is low overall, about 10% refuse or delay at least 1 vaccine and many express concerns. Providers must be ready to address these concerns.

Headlines: HIV-Infected Patients Respond Poorly to Pneumococcal Vaccine
Teaser: Whether they receive it before they begin antiretroviral therapy or after at least 6 months of therapy, only 20% respond.

Headlines: Vaccination Exemptions Rise in California Amid Concerns
Teaser: Increasing rates of parents choosing 'personal belief exemptions' increase as concerns over dropping vaccination gain momentum.

Headlines: Pediatric Rotavirus Vaccination Reduces Prevalence in Adults
Teaser: The prevalence of rotavirus in adults dropped by half after widespread pediatric vaccination against the virus began in the US in 2006; a dramatic decline in pediatric disease was seen by 2008.

Headlines: Europe Okays Pneumonia Vaccine for Adults 50 Years and Older
Teaser: Pfizer's Prevenar 13 is the first and only pneumococcal conjugate vaccine approved for use in adults in the European Union.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Protection Against Anal Disease in Men
Teaser: The quadrivalent vaccine reduces rates of anal neoplasias in men who have sex with men.

Headlines: ACIP Recommends HBV Vaccine in Patients With Diabetes
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices recommends the HBV vaccine for patients younger than 60 years who have diabetes.

Headlines: Researchers Believe Influenza Vaccines Need Improvement
Teaser: A new meta-analysis reveals critical gaps in the assessment of influenza vaccines' efficacy.

Headlines: Obesity Affects Influenza Vaccine Response
Teaser: A new North Carolina study indicates that the more patients weigh, the less protection they have from influenza vaccines, and the more severe the disease is.

Headlines: Do Not Give Flu Vaccine by Jet Injection, FDA Says
Teaser: Although several jet-injection devices are approved for delivering vaccines and other medications, no influenza vaccine has been cleared for this method of administration.

Headlines: Obese Individuals Respond Just as Well to Flu Vaccine
Teaser: It appears that body mass and obesity do not adversely affect the immune response to influenza vaccine; in fact, seroconversion to 1 component in the vaccine actually increased with body mass.

Headlines: Low-Dose Intradermal Flu Vaccine Effective as Intramuscular
Teaser: Injecting a lower dose of influenza vaccine intradermally in chronically ill adults was more immunogenic than a traditional full-dose intramuscular injection.

Headlines: Rotavirus Vaccine Benefits Now Far Outweigh Risks
Teaser: Risk-to-benefit ratios strongly support the use of current vaccines against rotavirus to prevent gastroenteritis in young children.

Headlines: Can You Teach New Docs Old Tricks?
Teaser: Younger primary care providers are more likely than their older counterparts to believe that vaccines do more harm than good, according to a new study.

Headlines: Pediatric Practices Discharge Families for Vaccine Refusal
Teaser: Twenty-one percent of Midwestern pediatricians say they have discharged families from their practices for continuing to refuse all vaccines. Parents mainly refused/deferred MMR, HPV, and flu vaccines.

Headlines: Researchers Report Positive Results in Malaria Vaccine Study
Teaser: A phase 3 clinical trial in 7 African countries suggests 50% improvement in malaria prevention.

Headlines: Vaccines for Addiction Gaining Momentum
Teaser: Vaccines have been successful in eradicating a wide variety of infectious diseases; now research suggests they hold promise in the treatment and/or prevention of substance abuse and addiction.

Headlines: CDC: National HPV Vaccine Programs Yet to Spread in Americas
