Teaser: Only 4 of the 35 countries in the Americas, represented by the Pan-American Health Organization, have national or regional immunization programs; more effort is needed.

Headlines: California Minors No Longer Need Parental  Okay for HPV Shot
Teaser: California physicians and nurses rallied behind the new law that some social conservatives construe as sidestepping parental supervision.

Headlines: Role for HPV Vaccines in HPV-Positive Oropharyngeal Cancer?
Teaser: A dramatic increase in oropharyngeal cancer testing positive for human papillomavirus (HPV) suggests that HPV vaccines might play a role.

Headlines: Parents Often Shun Recommended Childhood Vaccine Schedule
Teaser: Parents weigh perceived low disease risk vs perceived high risk for side effects.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Policy: At Odds With Evidence-Based Medicine?
Teaser: According to a new study, there is a major discrepancy in claims regarding the safety and efficacy of the human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccines.

Headlines: No Increase in Autoimmune Conditions From Use of HPV Vaccine
Teaser: In a large population of young women aged 9 to 26 years receiving quadrivalent human papillomavirus vaccine, researchers found no increase in new-onset cases for 16 autoimmune conditions surveyed.

Headlines: Oral HPV Infection: Higher in Men, Transmitted by Sex
Teaser: A much higher incidence of human papillomavirus (HPV) in men than women raises the question of whether boys should be getting the HPV vaccine in addition to girls.

Headlines: Most US Teenagers Lack Hepatitis A Immunization
Teaser: Most adolescents in the United States lack immunization for hepatitis A, leaving them susceptible to infection going into adulthood. Greater provider education about vaccine efficacy is advised.

Headlines: No Intussusception Rise Seen With Vaccine Reintroduction
Teaser: Updated rotavirus vaccines are not associated with an increased risk for the severe bowel obstruction that was associated with the previous rotavirus vaccine, according to results of a new study.

Headlines: Experimental Hepatitis C Vaccine Shows Early Promise
Teaser: A new vaccine against hepatitis C has shown promising results in an early-stage clinical trial.

Headlines: Trials for Novel Influenza Vaccine Likely by Spring
Teaser: HHS has asked 2 manufacturers to develop investigational lots of vaccine against the novel swine influenza virus that has surfaced in 5 states but has not yet shown signs of widespread transmission.

Headlines: Work Begins on Possible Vaccine Against Novel Flu Bug
Teaser: The CDC has developed a 'seed virus' that drug companies can use to make a vaccine in case the new A(H3N2)v strain is found to circulate from person to person on a widespread, sustained basis.

Headlines: Novel Swine Flu Virus Now Reported in 5 States, Says CDC
Teaser: Since July, 12 patients have caught a swine influenza virus that borrows a gene from the 2009 pandemic virus. In 2 states, the virus apparently spread from person to person on a limited basis.

Headlines: Immune Response May Render HIV Vaccine Ineffective
Teaser: Patients' immune response to adenovirus-based vaccine components may explain the lack of benefit observed in some vaccine trials.

Headlines: Study: HPV Vaccine Doesn't Encourage Risky Sexual Activity
Teaser: A CDC survey shows no evidence that the HPV vaccine encourages risky behavior among adolescents and young women.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccine Safe for Kids with Sickle Cell Anemia
Teaser: There is no association between trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine and sickle cell crisis hospitalization in children with sickle cell anemia, according to a recent study.

Headlines: Norovirus Vaccine Looks Promising in Preliminary Study
Teaser: A phase 1/phase 2 study provided proof of concept for a new norovirus vaccine, but it is still years from the market.

Headlines: Single Vaccine Dose Protects Infants and Mothers Against H1N1
Teaser: A single dose of a nonadjuvanted 2009 influenza A(H1N1) vaccine induced a strong immune response in pregnant women and conferred a high rate of seroprotection in newborns.

Headlines: Hepatitis A, B Susceptibility High in Patients on Methadone
Teaser: Coinfection with hepatitis C carries extra risks; the high rates underscore the need to vaccinate those in drug treatment programs.

Headlines: Teen Vaccination Rate Rising, But Not Enough, Study Suggests
Teaser: Clinicians are advised to recommend and administer all advisable vaccines during checkups.

Headlines: Vaccine Use Lowers H influenzae Burden
Teaser: Incidence of disease plunges 92% for children younger than 5 years.

Headlines: ACIP Declines to Recommend Zoster Vaccine for Under-60s
Teaser: Despite recent approval for use in adults aged 50 to 59 years, supply issues should be considered.

Headlines: Epstein-Barr Virus Vaccine May Soon Enter Phase 3 Trial
Teaser: There is currently no vaccine to prevent EBV infection, and no way for physicians to predict whether an EBV-infected person will develop virus-associated cancer.

Headlines: Single Flu Shot Safe for Kids With Egg Allergy
Teaser: Giving the trivalent influenza vaccine to children with severe egg allergy in a single dose is safe and well tolerated, according to interim results of a 2-year study.

Headlines: Measles Vaccines Not Associated With Febrile Seizure Risk
Teaser: A large study finds no significant increase in febrile seizures among children taking the combination MMRV vaccine compared with those taking MMR followed by a separate varicella vaccine.

Headlines: No Benefit to Zoster Booster Vaccine
Teaser: A second vaccine against varicella zoster virus does not significantly boost immunogenicity.

Headlines: Travelers to At-Risk Areas Often Fail to Get Rabies Shot
Teaser: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports that many travelers fail to get a rabies vaccination, especially those visiting friends and relatives.

Headlines: Belief in Flu Shot's Value Boosts Health Workers' Uptake
Teaser: Believing that influenza prevention is important was the biggest predictor of healthcare workers' willingness to be vaccinated against seasonal influenza, according to a recent meta-analysis.

Headlines: First Quadrivalent Flu Vaccine Approved, Debuts Fall 2013
Teaser: The 4-part vaccine will contain 2 strains of influenza A and 2 of influenza B to cover more viral bets. The current trivalent vaccine has 2 A strains, but only 1 B strain.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccine Less Effective on Elderly Than Thought
Teaser: Earlier findings associating vaccine with decreased mortality may be the result of bias, investigators say.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Recommended for Boys in New AAP Guidelines
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics has issued new guidelines for use of the human papillomavirus vaccine, broadening the recommendations to include boys.

Headlines: All Ages Should Get Tdap Shots, Says CDC Panel
Teaser: The agency's Advisory Committee for Vaccination Practices recommended Tdap for seniors on a routine basis, finally covering all age groups.

Headlines: More Antigen Improves Flu Shots in HIV Patients
Teaser: Increasing the hemagglutinin (HA) dose of the 2009 H1N1 flu vaccine improves its immunogenicity in HIV patients, researchers have found.

Headlines: PCV13 Vaccine Proves Cost-Effective
Teaser: The 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine is a cost-effective alternative to 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine. Its effectiveness against nonbacteremic pneumococcal pneumonia is unclear.

Headlines: Low Febrile Seizure Risk After Acellular Pertussis Vaccine
Teaser: The risk for febrile seizure increases after administration of the acellular pertussis vaccine, but the absolute risk remains small, and vaccination does not raise the risk of epilepsy.

Headlines: Adenovirus Deaths Rose in US Military During Vaccine Gap
Teaser: Adenovirus-associated deaths increased among US military personnel when vaccination ceased for 12 years; vaccine administration resumed October 2011.

Headlines: U.S. Delays Decision on Novartis's Meningitis Vaccine
Teaser: U.S. authorities have asked Novartis for more information on its meningitis vaccine Menveo, holding up the company's application to extend the use of the drug to American toddlers and infants.

Headlines: Physicians Should Weigh Mandatory Flu Vaccination for Staff
Teaser: A federal advisory committee recommends that healthcare employers "strongly consider" mandatory immunization for employees if voluntary efforts fall short.

Headlines: US Vaccination Coverage Remained Low in 2010
Teaser: Vaccination coverage for adults in the United States in 2010 fell far below Healthy People 2020 aims and need to be increased substantially to lower the burden of vaccine-preventable diseases.

Headlines: Measles Cases Decreasing Worldwide, but Challenges Remain
Teaser: A decade-long decline in measles cases reversed in 2010, with 40% of countries not meeting the annual incidence target of fewer than 5 cases per million population.

Headlines: H1N1 Pandemic Flu Vaccine May Protect Kids Across Two Seasons
Teaser: H1N1 antibody levels remain high in children a year after immunization with a monovalent adjuvanted pandemic swine influenza vaccine, a UK team reports.

Headlines: Controversial Amendments Injected Into Florida Vaccine Bill
Teaser: Pharmacists descended on the state capitol Wednesday to support a bill sponsored by state Rep. Ana Rivas Logan, R-Miami, which would allow them to give shingles and pneumonia vaccines to seniors.

Headlines: ACIP Issues 2012 Adult Immunization Schedule
Teaser: The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices has issued the 2012 adult immunization schedule, which has broadened the recommendations for HPV and HBV vaccination.

Headlines: AAP Updates Childhood and Adolescent Immunization Schedules
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics has issued the 2012 immunization schedules for children and adolescents and advises clinicians to use all 3 schedules together, not as stand-alone schedules.

Headlines: HPV Vaccination Offers Herd Protection
Teaser: The HPV vaccine aids both treated and untreated women. HPV prevalence among treated women declined from 32% to 10%; prevalence among untreated women declined from 30% to 15%.

Headlines: Bird Flu Vaccine Now? More Than a Shot in the Dark
Teaser: Culls of hundreds of thousands of chickens, turkeys and ducks to stem bird flu outbreaks rarely make international headlines these days, but they are a worryingly common event as the deadly virus continues its march across the globe.

Headlines: H1N1 Vaccine Safe in Pregnancy
Teaser: The adjuvanted influenza A(H1N1) vaccine is not associated with birth defects, preterm delivery, or fetal growth restriction.

Headlines: New ACIP Recommendations on Pneumococcal, Influenza Vaccines
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices voted to recommend the addition of PCV13 to PPSV23 for immunocompromised adults and to recommend a second dose of influenza vaccine for some children.

Headlines: More Parents Delaying Vaccines; Most Children Never Catch Up
Teaser: Children who follow alternative vaccination schedules typically have more provider visits and receive fewer shots than children who follow current guidelines, and they do not usually catch up later.

Headlines: FDA Approves Combo Meningitis Vaccine for Infants
Teaser: The vaccine, called Menhibrix, guards against 2 bacteria that can cause meningitis. The first dose may be given as early as 6 weeks of age, a first for meningococcal vaccines.

Headlines: Influenza Mild in the US During 2011-2012 Season: CDC
Teaser: The 2011-2012 influenza season in the United States was milder than it has been for several years, but the US Centers for Disease Control and         Prevention (CDC) urges year-round vigilance.

Headlines: Communication is Key in Conveying Vaccine Safety Message
Teaser: To counter the antivaccine campaign, clinicians need to consider the roots of vaccine fears.

Headlines: Measles Jumps From Unvaccinated Kids to Unvaccinated Adults
Teaser: ESPID 2012: In France, the country hit hardest in last year's European measles outbreak, details from one region show how the disease was manifested in unvaccinated children and adults.

Headlines: Progress and Continued Challenges in Eradicating Polio
Teaser: This report highlights recent progress toward global eradication of polio, citing significant gains along with ongoing challenges in several regions.

Headlines: How Medical Practices Doubled Their Flu Vaccination Rates
Teaser: Starting the flu vaccination season in late August helped boost the number of people vaccinated.

Headlines: Big Pediatric Offices Linked to Lower Flu Vaccination Rates
Teaser: Every 10-fold increase in the number of total patients was linked to a decrease of 20% or more in patients vaccinated.

Headlines: Third MMR Dose Well-Tolerated During Mumps Outbreak
Teaser: A routine revaccination policy during mumps outbreaks would be reasonable, says former director of the National Immunization Program.

Headlines: Flu Vaccines Safe During Pregnancy
Teaser: More than 2 decades of adverse-events reports did not reveal any odd patterns among pregnant women who received flu vaccinations or their infants.

Headlines: Most Adults Clueless About Tdap Vaccine
Teaser: Eight of 10 people polled online were not aware of the existence of the combination tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis (Tdap) vaccine.

Headlines: Middle School Vaccine Coverage Improves With State Mandates
Teaser: Although state requirements raise middle school vaccine coverage, HPV and overall coverage lags.

Headlines: Text Messaging Program May Increase Flu Vaccination Rate
Teaser: Texting flu vaccine messages raised vaccination rate in a low-income, urban population.

Headlines: Vaccines Group Gets Cut-Price GSK, Merck Rotavirus Shots
Teaser: International vaccines group GAVI has struck a deal for bulk buying rotavirus shots from GlaxoSmithKline and Merck which cuts the price by two-thirds.

Headlines: Adverse Events Minor in Young Women Taking HPV4 Vaccine
Teaser: Pain at the injection site is the most common adverse event seen in women receiving the HPV4 vaccine.

Headlines: New Doubts About Prostate-Cancer Vaccine Provenge
Teaser: Prostate cancer vaccine Provenge (sipuleucel-T) has long incited passions unlike any other cancer therapy.

Headlines: Incomplete Rotavirus Vaccine Still Offers Protection: Study
Teaser: The oral pentavalent rotavirus vaccine (RV5; RotaTeq, Merck) protects children against rotavirus gastroenteritis even if they don't get all three shots, a study found.

Headlines: Pneumococcal Vaccine Effective in Kids, But for How Long?
Teaser: After the introduction of a 7-valent vaccine, fewer children were hospitalized for pneumococcal disease, but then the disease rebounded. Will the pattern repeat with the current 13-valent vaccine?

Headlines: Quadrivalent HPV Vaccine Appears Safe, but Skeptics Remain
Teaser: A large study shows that the quadrivalent human papillomavirus vaccine was not associated with serious safety concerns. But skeptics say that optimism about safety rests on unproven assumptions.

Headlines: Physicians Lead the Way in Flu Vaccinations
Teaser: The vaccination rate for all healthcare personnel continues to rise, except for those who work in long-term-care facilities, excluding physicians and nurses, the CDC says.

Headlines: Antiobesity 'Flab-Jab' Vaccine Works in Mice
Teaser: Although the control mice continued to gain weight, vaccinated mice lost up to 20% of their body weight within the first week.

Headlines: Good Results Reported in Norovirus Vaccine Trial
Teaser: A new norovirus vaccine showed good results in a small clinical trial.

Headlines: HIV-1 Vaccine Trial Reveals Resistant Genetic Signature
Teaser: Comparing HIV sequences in vaccinated vs placebo trial participants shows selection for resistance.

Headlines: EU Advises All Girls Need Cervical Cancer Vaccines
Teaser: All girls in Europe should be immunized against the human papillomavirus (HPV) and current vaccine coverage rates are far too low, European Union health officials have announced.

Headlines: Vaccine Exemption Rates Linked to Easy Admin Requirements
Teaser: Medical exemption rates for kindergarten immunizations remain low nationally, but rates are highest in states in which it is easiest to obtain the waivers.

Headlines: Slow Growth in HPV Shots for Girls Requires Physician Action
Teaser: The CDC says that physicians need to issue stronger recommendations for the HPV vaccine, which is currently out of favor among some social conservatives.

Headlines: High HPV Immunization Rates Achieved With PATH Initiative
Teaser: Exceptionally high immunization rates against the human papillomavirus (HPV) have been achieved in target-aged girls in India, Peru, Uganda, and Vietnam.

Headlines: MMR and Varicella Vaccinations Fall Short in Some States
Teaser: The CDC reports that among kindergarten students, vaccination rates reach target levels, with the exception of measles, mumps, and rubella.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccination Schedule for Children Updated
Teaser: New recommendations also provide information on the 2012-2013 vaccine strains and support use of the trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine in persons with mild egg allergies.

Headlines: Meningococcal Disease in Military at Historic Low
Teaser: A report of meningococcal disease in the US military from 2006 through 2010 demonstrates the efficacy of the meningococcal vaccine in this setting.

Headlines: Latest Flu Vaccine Again Guards Against Pandemic Virus
Teaser: The trivalent seasonal influenza vaccine for 2012-2013 contains the same pandemic virus used in vaccines since 2010-2011. It does not guard against H3N2v, the novel swine influenza virus currently in the news.

Headlines: Early Hepatitis A Vaccine Seropositivity Persists
Teaser: Maternal antibody status does not influence children's response to vaccine.n

Headlines: Sleep Duration Linked to Vaccine Response
Teaser: A new study suggests that shorter sleep duration is related to a decrease in clinical protection provided by a hepatitis B vaccine series.

Headlines: Risk for Cervical Cancer No Higher in HIV-Positive Women
Teaser: Among women with normal Pap tests, the 5-year cumulative risk for cervical cancer in situ is similar in HIV-positive and HIV-negative women.

Headlines: California Pertussis Epidemic Reveals Vaccine Gap
Teaser: The 2010 California pertussis epidemic sickened 9000, killed 10, and revealed a vaccine gap dangerous to the youngest infants.

Headlines: Australia to Provide HPV Vaccine to Boys
Teaser: Australia has become the first country to provide HPV vaccine to boys between the ages of 12 and 13 years.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Cell Culture Flu Vaccine
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has approved Flucelvax for influenza, representing the first approval for a cell culture vaccine for any infection.

Headlines: EMA Recommends Approval for Prevenar 13
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency has recommended approval of a pneumococcal 13-valent conjugate vaccine for Streptococcus pneumoniae-related diseases in children and adults

Headlines: FDA Panel Supports H5N1 Adjuvant Vaccine
Teaser: On the fast-track for review, the vaccine will be included in the US pandemic emergency stockpile if it is approved.

Headlines: FDA Panel Endorses Novel Hepatitis Vaccine Efficacy, Not Safety
Teaser: Committee members expressed concern about missing data and insufficient safety database.

Headlines: Invasive Pneumococcal Disease: 10-Conjugated Vaccine Protective
Teaser: A 2+1 vaccination schedule appears effective against invasive pneumococcal disease.

Headlines: Novartis' Vaccines Business Gets Chance to Prove Itself
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency has thrown Novartis' loss-making vaccines business a lifeline by recommending its meningitis B shot for approval, which means the pressure is on to make the product a commercial success.

Headlines: Meningococcal Conjugate Vaccine Appears Safe in Infants
Teaser: A pooled analysis suggests that a 2-dose series of MenACWY-D appears to be safe and immunogenic when given at ages 9 and 12 months.

Headlines: Healthcare Workers May Need HBV Boosters as Titers Drop
Teaser: In a study of healthcare workers previously vaccinated against hepatitis B virus as adults, antibody titers to HBV waned over time. Negative titers were associated with older age at vaccination.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Uptake for Adolescent Males Extremely Low
Teaser: Vaccination rates among adolescent males remained in the single digits a year after regulatory approval, and willingness to vaccinate declined over time.

Headlines: H1N1 Vaccination Decisions Offer Important Lessons
Teaser: The examples of peers, healthcare providers, and even the Obamas were more influential in parents' vaccination decisions than concern about disease risk.

Headlines: Flu Vaccine Halves CVD Risk; Skeptics Not Convinced
Teaser: A meta-analysis of four randomized controlled trials investigating how flu shots might affect short-term cardiovascular outcomes reports a shocking 50% decrease in major adverse CV events in the treated group. This is "interesting," but only a hypothesis-generating study that would need to be proven in a prospective study, skeptics say.

Headlines: ACIP Approves Revised MMR Recommendations
Teaser: The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices has updated the recommendations for at-risk groups and postexposure prophylaxis.

Headlines: ACIP Gives Nod to Meningitis Vaccine for High-Risk Infants
Teaser: The proposal recommends 4 doses of HibMenCY beginning at age 2 months.

Headlines: Incentives Prompt High Health Worker Flu Vaccine Acceptance
Teaser: In a large hospital system, more than 90% of healthcare workers were vaccinated after incentives and social pressure were combined.

Headlines: EMA: Evidence Insufficient to Link Flu Shot With Narcolepsy
Teaser: After an investigation, the European Medicines Agency said the evidence linking Pandemrix to narcolepsy is insufficient to draw conclusions, and 'does not lead to any new concerns.'

Headlines: Pap Tests Less Frequent Under New Guidelines
Teaser: The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists has issued new guidelines for cervical cancer screening.

Headlines: CDC Panel Expands Tdap Vaccine in Pregnancy Recommendation
Teaser: The ACIP has voted to expand the recommendation for the Tdap vaccine to encompass all pregnant women regardless of vaccination history, including repeat vaccinations in subsequent pregnancies.

Headlines: Staph Vaccine Linked to Multiorgan Failure and Death
Teaser: A trial of an experimental vaccine against Staphylococcus aureus to prevent bacteremia and wound infections after surgery has produced disappointing results, despite a robust immunologic response.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Does Not Increase Sexual Activity
Teaser: Girls who received the human papilloma virus vaccine at 11 or 12 years of age were no more likely to engage in sexual behavior than girls who did not receive the vaccine.

Headlines: UK Says Sanofi, Merck Recall Some Typhoid Vaccine Batches
Teaser: Sanofi Pasteur MSD, the vaccine joint venture of Sanofi and Merck, has recalled some batches of its typhoid vaccine because of concerns about effectiveness.

Headlines: Vaccination Rates in US Adults Showing Little Improvement
Teaser: Noninfluenza vaccination coverage for adults in the United States remains low for most routinely recommended vaccines and is still well below Healthy People 2020 targets, according to a CDC briefing.

Headlines: ACIP Issues 2013 Adult Immunization Schedule and Guidelines
Teaser: The Advisory Committee on Immunization 2013 adult immunization schedule includes recommendations to increase vaccination rates and changes to Tdap, pneumococcal, and influenza vaccine guidelines.

Headlines: AAP Issues 2013 Child/Adolescent Immunization Schedule
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics has issued the 2013 child/adolescent immunization schedule, including a new recommendation to give Tdap vaccine to adolescents and pregnant women.

Headlines: Egg-Allergic Children Shown to Safely Receive Flu Vaccine
Teaser: Children with a severe egg allergy showed no serious adverse effects from trivalent seasonal influenza vaccine.

Headlines: New Meningococcal Vaccine Recommended for High-Risk Infants
Teaser: The CDC has recommended that infants at high risk for meningococcal disease receive the Hib-MenCY-TT vaccine.

Headlines: Measles Cases and Deaths Fall Globally
Teaser: The number of measles deaths worldwide fell 71%, and the number of new cases fell 58%, between 2000 and 2011.

Headlines: Nearly Half of Children Fail to Receive Vaccines on Schedule
Teaser: Fewer parents each year follow the recommended vaccination schedules for their infants and toddlers.

Headlines: IOM Supports Safety of Childhood Immunization Schedule
Teaser: An IOM expert panel reviewed feedback from stakeholders and the literature and found no convincing evidence of increased risk linked to the current vaccine schedule for children up to 6 years of age.

Headlines: FDA Okays Novel Flu Vaccine Made Without Eggs, Viruses
Teaser: The new vaccine, Flublok, also dispenses with mercury-containing thimerosal and antibiotics.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccine Does Not Increase Fetal Death
Teaser: Influenza vaccination during pregnancy reduced the risk for influenza diagnosis and was not associated with increased fetal death.

Headlines: Diphtheria Vaccine Administered in the Thigh Appears Safer
Teaser: A new study of 1.4 million children shows less risk for local reaction among those given the diphtheria vaccine in the thigh rather than the arm.

Headlines: Drugmakers Report U.S. Shortages of Flu Vaccine, Tamiflu
Teaser: This year's early and potentially severe flu season has created shortages of the children's formulation of the leading treatment and most forms of the top-selling U.S. vaccine, according to their manufacturers.

Headlines: HPV Cancers Increase, Vaccination Rates Remain Low
Teaser: Incidence rates are rising for HPV-associated oropharyngeal and anal cancers, but vaccination coverage levels in the United States remain low.

Headlines: U.S. Doctors Feel Pinch of Flu Season, Push for Vaccinations
Teaser: When Dr. Diane Chaney arrived for her morning shift at the University of Chicago Medicine's emergency department on Monday, there were nine patients from the overnight shift waiting for treatment.

Headlines: Flu Vaccine at Quadruple Dose Needed for Those With HIV
Teaser: A high-dose influenza vaccine significantly boosts antibody response and seroconversion rates in patients with HIV.

Headlines: Thimerosal for Vaccines: AAP Endorses WHO Statement
Teaser: The World Health Organization asks for thimerosal exemption in a United Nations Environmental Program treaty under development for limiting mercury exposures worldwide.

Headlines: FDA Okays 4-Strain Seasonal Influenza Vaccine
Teaser: Fluarix Quadrivalent is the first intramuscular vaccine to protect against 2 A virus strains and 2 B virus strains.

Headlines: Flu Season Gets an Early Start, CDC Says
Teaser: Based on circulating strains, the CDC predicts a year of high activity for influenza and calls for an aggressive vaccination strategy.

Headlines: TDaP Vaccine no More Risky to Elderly Than Td Vaccine
Teaser: Off-label pertussis protection appears to be safe for older adults.

Headlines: Acellular Pertussis Vaccine Protection May Wane
Teaser: Risk for pertussis is associated with time since last dose and with missed doses.

Headlines: S aureus Vaccine for Heart Surgery Appears Harmful
Teaser: A vaccine to prevent postoperative S aureus infection is associated with an overall lack of efficacy and a higher mortality rate in a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: No Evidence Multiple Vaccines Raise Autism Risk, CDC Says
Teaser: The number of vaccines administered, either in a single day or during the first 2 years of life, is not associated with the risk for autism, a new CDC study shows.

Headlines: Texting Fails to Boost Flu Shots in Pregnant Women
Teaser: Text message reminders don't increase flu vaccinations in pregnant women, according to a small pilot study.

Headlines: ACOG Advises Ob-Gyns to Promote Vaccinations to Patients
Teaser: A new Committee Opinion highlights the opportunity ob-gyns have to integrate regular vaccinations into their practice and recommends they offer patients Tdap, HPV, and flu vaccines.

Headlines: How Vaccine Scares Cast Shadows Over Science
Teaser: At a Finnish medical convention in January 2011, a colleague approached neurologist Markku Partinen, laid a hand his shoulder and said: 'Markku, it's going to be a bad year for you.'

Headlines: Prostate Cancer Vaccine Shows Promise
Teaser: A personalized peptide vaccine combined with dexamethasone can harness the body's immune system in prostate cancer, a prize-winning study suggests.

Headlines: Anthrax Vaccine Testing in Children: Strict New Guidelines
Teaser: An independent commission has devised a series of steps to minimize risk to children in both pre- and postevent scenarios.

Headlines: Travel-related Illness May Be Preventable With Preparation
Teaser: A new international surveillance study finds that pretravel preparation may help prevent common travel-related illnesses.

Headlines: HPV and Other Vaccinations Lagging in Teens
Teaser: Many teens are still not getting the recommended vaccines, according to a recent survey.

Headlines: Flu Vaccine Curbs Hospitalization in the Elderly
Teaser: Vaccination can avert well over half of all influenza-associated hospitalizations, according to an effectiveness study by Tennessee-based researchers.

Headlines: Small Increase in Guillain-Barre with H1N1 2009 Vaccine
Teaser: A new study finds a small increased risk for Guillain-Barre syndrome with the influenza A (H1N1) 2009 vaccine, but researchers conclude the benefit of vaccination still outweighs the risk.

Headlines: Pertussis Incidence Rises as Fifth DTaP Dose Immunity Wanes
Teaser: An analysis of vaccinated children in Minnesota and Oregon shows an increase in pertussis incidence as immunity from the fifth DTaP dose wanes before the adolescent booster is due.

Headlines: FDA Panel Recommends 2013-2014 Flu Vaccine Strains
Teaser: The panel agrees with recommendations from the World Health Organization on the best components for next year's influenza vaccine.

Headlines: Study Again Finds Narcolepsy Risk With H1N1 Flu Vaccine
Teaser: A study from England finds an increased risk for narcolepsy in children who received adjuvanted pandemic H1N1 2009 flu vaccine, consistent with findings from Finland and Sweden.

Headlines: TDAP Screening May Improve Vaccination in Gynecology Clinics
Teaser: Gynecologists may be able to improve the pertussis vaccination rate by screening their patients for tetanus, diphtheria, and pertussis (TDAP) vaccination during routine visits.

Headlines: FDA Rejects Novel Hepatitis B Vaccine
Teaser: Heplisav's novel adjuvant boosts immunogenicity but may be associated with autoimmune disorders.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccine Efficacy Significantly Lower in Elderly
Teaser: The vaccine prevents one half to two thirds of influenza-related medical visits in younger age groups but is significantly less effective among the elderly.

Headlines: CDC Panel Endorses PCV13 Use in Immunocompromised Children
Teaser: The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices also addressed issues regarding Hib immunization.

Headlines: New TB Vaccine Not Significantly Effective
Teaser: MVA85A does not offer statistically significant protection against TB disease or infection in HIV-negative, BCG-vaccinated infants.

Headlines: FDA Extends Pneumococcal Vaccine Use to Older Children
Teaser: The FDA has approved Pfizer's Prevnar 13 pneumococcal vaccine for use in older children.

Headlines: Anti-HBV Vaccine Fails Against Chronic Hepatitis B
Teaser: A therapeutic vaccine candidate, aimed at breaking immune tolerance to the hepatitis B virus, failed in a recent trial, but the researchers believe the problem is that the adjuvant itself was too potent.

Headlines: Skipping Shots at Sick Visits Tied to Vaccine Delays
Teaser: Kids who don't get vaccines when they see their pediatrician for a sick visit - despite being due for the shots - are more likely to fall behind on immunizations and routine check-ups.

Headlines: New Smallpox Vaccine Recommended for Approval in EU
Teaser: Imvanex is a nonreplicating vaccine recommended for active immunization against smallpox in adults.

Headlines: EV71:  Vaccine Prevents Hand-Foot-Mouth, Associated Disease
Teaser: The first vaccine against enterovirus 71 helps prevent hand, foot, and mouth disease, as well as EV71-associated disease, according to phase 3 trial results.

Headlines: Glaxo Flu Shot May Raise Adult Narcolepsy Risk
Teaser: GlaxoSmithKline's H1N1 pandemic flu shot may put adults at higher risk of developing narcolepsy, not only children as previous studies found.

Headlines: Yellow Fever Vaccination: No Booster Needed for Immunity
Teaser: A WHO report indicates that a booster vaccination is not necessary for lasting protection against yellow fever.

Headlines: Synthetic Influenza Virus May Cut Vaccine Delivery Time
Teaser: Response time to influenza pandemics may be lessened by Internet use and synthetic vaccine technology.

Headlines: Vaccines: New Surveillance Tool Detects Public Concerns
Teaser: A new global media surveillance tool detects and monitors public concerns about vaccines in real time, which could help public health officials avoid vaccination refusals and disease outbreaks.

Headlines: Drugmakers Cut Price of Cervical Cancer Shots for Poor Countries
Teaser: Merck and GlaxoSmithKline have cut the price of their cervical cancer shots in a deal that will deliver them to poor countries for less than $5 a dose.

Headlines: Typhoid Fever Affects Young International Travelers
Teaser: Children traveling to countries where typhoid fever is endemic have the highest risk of contracting the disease; families should be counseled on the availability of vaccines.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine: 2 Doses as Good as 3 Doses in Young Women
Teaser: Young women who received 2 doses of HPV vaccine had immune responses to HPV-16 and HPV-18 that were noninferior to those of young women who received 3 doses of the vaccine, according to a new study.

Headlines: Steroids Tied to Local Reactions to Yellow Fever 17D Vaccine
Teaser: Patients receiving systemic corticosteroids seem to be at particular risk for local reactions to the yellow fever 17D vaccine, French researchers say.

Headlines: HIV Vaccine Study Halted Due to Failure to Prevent Infection
Teaser: An interim analysis has revealed that an experimental vaccine failed to prevent HIV infection or reduce viral load among vaccine recipients who became infected with HIV.

Headlines: New USD 5.5 Billion Plan Aims to Rid World of Polio by 2018
Teaser: Health groups said could rid the world of polio by 2018 with a $5.5 billion vaccination and monitoring plan to stop the disease taking hold once more now there are only a handful of cases worldwide.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Works, but Many American Parents Still Squeamish
Teaser: Six years into a successful vaccination campaign, Australia shows a sharp decline in new cases of HPV.

Headlines: Vaccination Choice Influenced by Social Networks
Teaser: Social networks appear to be most important for parents who choose not to vaccinate.

Headlines: Shingles Vaccine Effective but Underused in Elderly
Teaser: Incidence of herpes zoster and postherpetic neuralgia was markedly lower in people who were immunized, but 96% of the study population had not received the vaccine.

Headlines: Physician's Preventive Health Practices Predict Patient's
Teaser: If physicians improve their vaccination and screening rates, their patients may follow suit.

Headlines: Candidate Vaccine Against RSV Meets Mid-Stage Trial Goals
Teaser: Novavax announced top-line data from the phase 2 clinical trial of its respiratory syncytial virus vaccine candidate in women of childbearing age accomplished the trial's protocol-specified objectives.

Headlines: Varicella Vaccine Works Well Over Time
Teaser: Since its introduction in the mid-1990s, varicella vaccine has reduced the average incidence of chickenpox by as much as tenfold, according to researchers.

Headlines: Program Revision Improves HBV Vaccination in High-Risk Infants
Teaser: A new approach to prophylactic vaccination of infants born to mothers with hepatitis B virus infection is improving outcomes, Swedish investigators say.

Headlines: Parents, Health-Care Providers Share Beliefs About Vaccines
Teaser: Parents and health-care providers share common attitudes and beliefs about vaccines, according to survey results.

Headlines: Israel Extends Polio Vaccination Campaign
Teaser: Israel will administer the active polio vaccine to children nationwide beginning on August 18, stepping up an inoculation campaign currently limited to the south of the country.

Headlines: Flu Vaccine Not Tied to Pregnancy Complications
Teaser: Israel said it was launching a campaign to administer the active polio vaccine to children in its southern region after tests detected at least 1,000 carriers of the virus in that area.

Headlines: Israel to Launch Limited Active Polio Virus Campaign in South
Teaser: The quadrivalent meningococcal conjugate vaccine Menveo is now indicated for use in children as young as 2 months.

Headlines: FDA OKs Use of Meningitis Vaccine in Infants, Toddlers
Teaser: Median vaccination coverage in the United States continued to be high among kindergarten enrollees for the 2012-2013 school year, with a low overall level of exemptions, according to the CDC.

Headlines: Vaccination Rates for 2012-2013 Kindergarteners High Overall
Teaser: HPV vaccination rates in US girls aged 13 to 17 years failed to increase between 2011 and 2012, which has US federal health officials concerned.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Use Stalls in US Girls
Teaser: The bivalent human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine reduced oral HPV infections in Costa Rican women by more than 90%, researchers say.

Headlines: Cervical Cancer Vaccine May Also Guard Against Oral Cancer
Teaser: Pneumonia vaccine bestows herd immunity, protecting the oldest from severe disease.

Headlines: Pneumonia Vaccine Cuts Hospitalization in Infants, Elderly
Teaser: The reality of HPV vaccination does not match the professional support for the prevention strategy.

Headlines: HPV: Less Than a Third of Patients Vaccinated
Teaser: An early stage study suggests an experimental DNA vaccine may be able to tame bits of the immune system that go haywire in people with type 1 diabetes, offering hope for a new way to delay or prevent the autoimmune disease.

Headlines: Type 1 Diabetes Vaccine Shows Promise in Early Study
Teaser: The health ministry is not suspending the use of the vaccines but is no longer recommending them.

Headlines: Japan Withdraws HPV Vaccine Recommendation for Girls
Teaser: Members of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's immunization committee have voted unanimously to recommend the egg-free vaccine Flublok as an option for people with severe egg allergy.

Headlines: CDC Immunization Experts OK Egg-Free Influenza Vaccine

Headlines: MMR: ACIP Vaccine Recommendations, Japan Rubella Outbreak
Teaser: Physicians should offer meningitis vaccine to men planning to participate in Gay Pride activities in New York and elsewhere, experts say.

Headlines: Meningitis Vaccination Needed Before Gay Pride Week
Teaser: In a major Chicago hospital, healthcare staff overwhelmingly chose vaccination over leaving their jobs when the flu shot became mandatory.

Headlines: Mandatory Vaccination of Healthcare Workers a Success
Teaser: Influenza A (H3N2), influenza A (H1N1)pdm09, and influenza B viruses cocirculated during the 2012 to 2013 US influenza season; agency announces 2013-2014 vaccine composition.

Headlines: CDC Reports US Influenza Activity, New Vaccine Strains
Teaser: Fluzone Quadrivalent is the first and only 4-strain flu vaccine approved for use in children aged as young as 6 months.

Headlines: New Quadrivalent Influenza Vaccine Gets FDA Nod
Teaser: The number of New York parents who had their child skip at least one required vaccine due to religious reasons increased over the past decade, according to a new study.

Headlines: One HPV Shot May Be Enough to Protect Against Cervical Cancer
Teaser: A single dose of human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine may protect against cervical cancer, according to a randomized trial from Costa Rica.

Headlines: More Than 20 Million Children Worldwide Not Being Vaccinated
Teaser: Further improvement might require country-specific programs that deal with resource issues associated with incomplete vaccinations and with parental attitudes associated with nonvaccination.

Headlines: Brazil to Make Measles/Rubella Vaccine for Poor Nations
Teaser: Brazil's top biomedical research and development center announced plans to produce a combined measles and rubella vaccine for developing countries, mainly in Africa.

Headlines: ACIP OKs 2014 Adult Immunization Schedule With Changes
Teaser: The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices voted unanimously to approve the 2014 adult immunization schedule.

Headlines: More Data Showing Flu Vaccine Lowers CVD Risk
Teaser: The latest report, from a meta-analysis of six randomized, controlled clinical trials that included 6735 patients, showed that the influenza vaccination     was associated with a 36% lower risk of cardiovascular events.

Headlines: New Survey Sheds Light on Low HPV Vaccination Rate
Teaser: Many parents of teen girls say they don't trust the vaccine and that their healthcare providers are not fully encouraging the series of injections.

Headlines: Flu Vaccination Rates Low Among Children
Teaser: The US Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices recommends that all children be vaccinated, but many are not receiving flu shots.

Headlines: Pneumococcal Vaccine Works on Virulent Strains
Teaser: Invasive pneumococcal disease caused by some of the most virulent serotypes declined after the new vaccine was introduced, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Rabies Kills 24,000 a Year in Africa; Vaccine Costly
Teaser: Rabies kills 24,000 people a year in Africa, most of them children, because many on the world's poorest continent cannot afford the cost of the vaccine, experts said on Thursday.

Headlines: High-Dose Flu Shot Shows Promise in Elderly
Teaser: The vaccine delivers 4 times the standard dose of antigen.

Headlines: Diabetes Patients Should Get Flu Shots, Not Nasal Spray
Teaser: Physicians and patients are being reminded that those with diabetes should get a flu shot at this time of year.

Headlines: 2-Dose Varicella Vaccine Having Substantial Effect
Teaser: The 2-dose varicella vaccine program, recommended beginning in 2006, has had a substantial effect on incidence, hospitalizations, and outbreaks in 2 active surveillance areas.

Headlines: Pertussis Cases Concentrated Near Vaccine Refusal Clusters
Teaser: A surge seen in pertussis cases in California in 2010 could reflect the effect of clusters of nonmedical vaccine refusals.

Headlines: Influenza: Vaccinate Kids as Soon as Possible, AAP Says
Teaser: An updated AAP statement calls for all children 6 months of age or older to receive influenza vaccination as soon as it is available, using either trivalent or quadrivalent vaccine.

Headlines: Vaccine Coverage Lags for US Teenagers, Especially for HPV
Teaser: Despite gains for some vaccines, coverage lags for US teenagers, especially for HPV among girls.

Headlines: ICAAC to Feature Higher Cure Rate Options for Hepatitis C
Teaser: Infectious disease physicians are gearing up for a pivotal change in clinical practice and anticipate that some hepatitis C infections will be cured.

Headlines: Indian Firm Develops New Vaccine to Fight Typhoid Fever
Teaser: Indian pharmaceutical company Bharat Biotech says it has developed a fourth-generation typhoid vaccine that will give long-term protection to infants and adults.

Headlines: Rotavirus Vaccine Benefits Extend Beyond Immediate Targets
Teaser: Fewer gastroenteritis hospitalizations among older children and adults suggest indirect effects of immunization, authors say.

Headlines: Flu Vaccination Reduces AMI Risk
Teaser: Yet another study, this time a case-control study from Australia, suggests there is a cardiovascular benefit to getting a flu shot.

Headlines: Fluzone High-Dose Flu Vaccine Efficacy in Elderly
Teaser: Sanofi said that a large clinical trial showed its Fluzone High-Dose vaccine to be more effective at preventing influenza in adults aged 65 and older than a standard dose of Fluzone.

Headlines: Seasonal Flu Widespread in the United States -- CDC
Teaser: Nearly half of the United States is reporting widespread influenza activity, most of it attributed to the H1N1 virus that caused a worldwide pandemic in 2009.

Headlines: Immune Response Stronger in Women Than in Men
Teaser: Testosterone appears to modulate lipid metabolism, and thereby modulate immune response.

Headlines: Herpes Zoster Linked Again to Increased Stroke, MI
Teaser: The vaccine that reduces herpes zoster might also cut risks for vascular events, including stroke, transient ischemic attack, and myocardial infarction, researchers speculate.

Headlines: Flu Vaccination in Health Workers May Enhance Patient Safety
Teaser: A systematic review has found moderate-quality evidence for flu vaccination in health workers, with higher-quality evidence for mortality; an expert opinion supports flu vaccine for health workers.

Headlines: One Lot of HPV Vaccine Gardasil Recalled
Teaser: A small number of vials of Gardasil in lot number J007354 may contain glass particles in what federal health officials call an 'isolated' manufacturing incident.

Headlines: Most States Letting Down Guard Against Infectious Disease
Teaser: A new study has issued a clarion call to improve the nation's ability to prevent, detect, and control diseases ranging from influenza to HIV.

Headlines: Influenza: 4-Antigen Vaccine Found Safe and Effective
Teaser: A company-sponsored study has found that a quadrivalent influenza vaccine may minimize the risk for mismatch between the vaccine B strain and the circulating influenza strain.

Headlines: Mandatory Immunizations for Clinicians, Staff, IDSA Says
Teaser: The Infectious Diseases Society of America and other ID societies have recommended that all healthcare employers require clinicians and staff receive immunizations recommended by the CDC's ACIP.

Headlines: Ramped-Up Campaign Lowers Global Rubella Cases by 86%
Teaser: A year after the World Health Organization updated its preferred strategy for introducing rubella vaccines, reported rubella cases among member states dropped by 86%.

Headlines: Vaccine May Prevent Progression to MS
Teaser: Giving BCG vaccine, used to prevent tuberculosis, to patients with clinically isolated syndrome appears to prevent progression to clinically definite MS, preliminary results suggest.

Headlines: IDSA Guidelines: Vaccinate Immunocompromised Patients ‏
Teaser: New Infectious Diseases Society of America guidelines stress that most immunocompromised people should be vaccinated against influenza and other infections.

Headlines: Acellular Pertussis Vaccine May Not Prevent Transmission
Teaser: In a primate model, acellular pertussis vaccines protected against disease but did not prevent infection and transmission, whereas whole-cell vaccines were more effective.

Headlines: Disease Surveillance Enters the 21st Century
Teaser: Project Tycho has ignited a collaboration with the US Open Government Initiative and generated hope that such projects will be the new norm in disease surveillance.

Headlines: Shingles Vaccine Uptake Disappointing
Teaser: A quarter of all cases of shingles can cause ocular complications, vision loss, and pain, but they can be prevented with a vaccine.

Headlines: A Review of Barriers to HPV Vaccination Among Teens
Teaser: A new study has found that barriers to HPV vaccination among US adolescents range from financial and social issues to parental attitudes, and highlights the need for better vaccine education.

Headlines: Flu Vaccine Allergy May Be Attributed to Gelatin, Not Egg
Teaser: An allergy to egg is no longer contraindicated for influenza vaccination, but gelatin allergy, though rare, can cause anaphylaxis.

Headlines: WHO Aims for Next-Generation Malaria Vaccine by 2030
Teaser: The updated WHO Malaria Vaccine Technology Roadmap includes development by 2030 of a high-efficacy second-generation vaccine that will target both Plasmodium vivax and Plasmodium falciparum.

Headlines: Dispute Over Meeting Thwarts Polio Vaccinations in Sudan - UN
Teaser: The United Nations said it had failed to vaccinate 165,000 children against polio in 2 Sudanese states after the government and rebels disagreed over whether another meeting was needed.ccinate 165,000 children against polio in two Sudanese states after the government and rebels - who had both agreed to the immunization campaign - disagreed over whether another meeting was needed.

Headlines: Syria, Neighbors to Vaccinate Children Against Polio
Teaser: More than 20 million children are to be vaccinated in Syria and neighboring countries against polio to try to stop the spread of the disease following its re-emergence there after 14 years.

Headlines: Polio Virus in Syria and Israel May Endanger Europe
Teaser: Two infectious disease experts warn that a polio outbreak in Syria caused by wild-type polio virus 1 and asymptomatic infections in Israel might endanger Europe and other neighboring regions.

Headlines: Barriers to Adult Vaccination Identified
Teaser: Many physicians are not stocking all recommended adult vaccines and often do not even assess vaccination status during patient visits.

Headlines: ACIP Issues 2014 Immunization Schedule for Adults
Teaser: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices has updated its vaccination recommendations for adults.

Headlines: HPV At-Home Tests Have a Future, Researchers Say
Teaser: Certain tests can detect precancerous cervical cells from self-collected samples with nearly the same accuracy as a physician's swab taken in a clinic, according to a new review of past studies.

Headlines: ACIP Releases 2014 Pediatric Vaccine Schedule
Teaser: Pediatricians, family physicians, obstetrician/gynecologists, and immunization experts from the CDC have approved the updated 2014 immunization schedule for US children and teenagers.

Headlines: CDC Finds Eye Splashes, Misdelivery of Rotavirus Vaccine
Teaser: CDC researchers have reported several cases of misdelivered oral, live rotavirus vaccine by injection and eye splashes during administration, recommend prevention with proper education and training.

Headlines: Reassuring Data on Pandemrix, Narcolepsy Aside
Teaser: A Swedish study confirms an increased risk of narcolepsy in children and adolescents vaccinated with the pandemic H1N1 flu vaccine Pandemrix and provides reassuring results on other neurological and immune-related events.

Headlines: Production Snag Forces Worldwide Hold on GSK Chickenpox Vaccines
Teaser: GlaxoSmithKline has stopped worldwide deliveries of two chickenpox vaccines for children after discovering that some batches produced at its factory in Wavre, Belgium, were not up to standard.

Headlines: New Evidence: Diabetes Does Up Risk for Flu-Related Illness
Teaser: Guidelines call for vaccination of working-age people with diabetes, but the data to verify this approach have been lacking. Now the strongest evidence to     date finds this strategy is justified.

Headlines: HIV Patients Lose Seroprotection Before Vaccine Boosters Are Due
Teaser: Vaccine-induced antibodies may wane more quickly than usual in patients with HIV, who might therefore lose their protection before they receive a booster, if current guidelines are followed.

Headlines: HPV Test Awareness, Knowledge Still Low
Teaser: Americans are more aware that there is a test for human papillomavirus (HPV) than their counterparts in the UK and Australia, according to a new study, but few people know much more than that.

Headlines: TB: Mass Isoniazid Preventive Therapy Is Ineffective
Teaser: Mass screening and isoniazid treatment for latent TB did not significantly affect TB control in South African gold mines, even though isoniazid successfully prevented TB during treatment.

Headlines: U.S. Shortage of Tamiflu for Children Resolved
Teaser: A temporary shortage in the United States of one of the leading flu medicines used to treat children with the sometimes deadly virus has been resolved, Roche, the maker of Tamiflu (oseltamivir), said.

Headlines: Pakistani City Is World's Biggest Reservoir of Polio Viruses
Teaser: Pakistan's volatile northwestern city of Peshawar is the largest reservoir of endemic polio viruses in the world, the World Health Organization said.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine and Others Safe, Effective When Coadministered
Teaser: The HPV vaccine and other vaccines commonly given to older children, adolescents, and young adults were safe and effective when coadministered.

Headlines: Rabies Vaccine Doesn't Always Provide Protection
Teaser: Nearly one third of veterinary students in a new study had antibody concentrations that could have been too low to protect them against rabies two years after vaccination.

Headlines: Rituximab, Abatacept May Interfere With Influenza Vaccine
Teaser: Most antirheumatic treatments did not reduce H1N1 flu vaccine efficacy, but immune response was severely reduced in those receiving rituximab and may have been reduced in those receiving abatacept.

Headlines: Rotavirus Vaccines Carry Low Risk for Intussusception
Teaser: Data from 2 US surveillance studies suggest that the risks for intestinal obstruction from currently available rotavirus vaccines are far outweighed by the benefits.

Headlines: BCG Vaccine and Risk of Acute Lower Respiratory Infection in Kids
Teaser: Children vaccinated with Bacille Calmette-Guérin  may have less risk of lower respiratory infection than unvaccinated children; the protection may increase in those vaccinated against diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis.

Headlines: Liquid Tamiflu Shortage in US
Teaser: The liquid formulation of the antiviral drug oseltamivir is in short supply because of early strong demand, according to its manufacturer.

Headlines: Flu Vaccine May Improve Birth Outcomes for Pregnant Women
Teaser: Canadian researchers have found that pregnant women receiving the influenza vaccine vs not receiving the influenza vaccine have lower odds of preterm delivery and of having a low-birth-weight child.

Headlines: Provaccine Messages May Backfire Among Parents
Teaser: Researchers have found that current public health messages may be reducing the misperception about vaccines and autism but not increasing intent to vaccinate future children.

Headlines: 2 Enterovirus 71 Vaccines Successful in Phase 3 Trials
Teaser: The inactivated vaccines had good safety profiles.

Headlines: Next Year's Flu Vaccine Strains Unchanged From This Year's
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee unanimously recommended that the virus strains used for the 2014-2015 influenza vaccine should remain the same as those in the 2013-2014 vaccine.

Headlines: Vaccine Costs Affect Pediatrician Stocking Decisions
Teaser: A survey of pediatricians and family physicians in private practice has revealed high levels of dissatisfaction on reimbursement for vaccine purchasing and administration.

Headlines: Polio-Like Syndrome Surfaces in California
Teaser: Researchers describe 5 cases of children with limb paralysis and abnormal MRI scans, but there are reports of others.

Headlines: Nonspecific Benefits Seen With On-time, In-Sequence MMR Dose
Teaser: Administering the MMR vaccine on schedule and in sequence with other vaccinations may reduce the risk for hospitalization for any infection.

Headlines: HPV Vaccination for Girls and Boys Urged by Ob/Gyns
Teaser: Broad HPV coverage could prevent 53,000 cases of cervical cancer, the authors assert.

Headlines: Flu Vaccine More Effective Than Last Year's, CDC Says
Teaser: The agency's bad news is that the pandemic A(H1N1) virus -- the dominant bug circulating now -- is hitting adults aged under 65 years just as hard as it did in 2009-2010.

Headlines: Bacteremia Appears to Increase 30-Day Risk of MI or Stroke
Teaser: Patients with bacteremia when admitted to hospital are at high risk of having an MI or stroke within 30 days, researchers report.

Headlines: To Stop Lyme, Vaccinate...the Mice?
Teaser: A new oral vaccine to prevent Lyme disease in mice decreased infection rates in ticks and might help break the cycle of transmission to humans.

Headlines: Minor Infections May Increase Stroke Risk in Children
Teaser: Common infections are associated with a significantly higher chance of stroke in children, and routine vaccinations appear to be protective, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Fewer HPV Vaccine Doses May Still Lower Risk for Condyloma
Teaser: Maximum reduction in condyloma risk occurred after 3 doses of quadrivalent HPV vaccine, but 2 doses also considerably reduced condyloma risk, mandating further study regarding cervical cancer risk.

Headlines: Most Severe Influenza Seen in Young, Unvaccinated Adults
Teaser: The influenza vaccine appears to protect against severe illness requiring hospitalization; in a case series, only 2 of 22 patients who required intensive care had been vaccinated.

Headlines: Narrow Provider Networks Need More Work, ACP Says
Teaser: In its annual report on the condition of US healthcare, the medical society said that overly narrow networks limit patient access to clinicians in ACA exchange plans.

Headlines: West Nile Cost United States Nearly $800 Million in 14 Years
Teaser: West Nile virus has cost the United States  $778 million in hospitalizations and lost productivity in the 14 years since it was first detected in the Western Hemisphere.

Headlines: Noninfluenza Vaccination Rates Remain Low Among Adults
Teaser: Rates of immunization against vaccine-preventable diseases other than influenza are far from ideal, epidemiologists say.

Headlines: Pregnant RN Fired for Refusing Flu Vaccine: Not So Simple?
Teaser: Hospitals increasingly require the influenza vaccine for employees in accordance with CDC guidelines. Nursing groups counter that the flu vaccine shouldn't be mandatory, and RN Dreonna Breton agrees

Headlines: Further Evidence for Epsilon Toxin as MS Trigger
Teaser: Researchers have reported that the bacterial toxin kills myelin-producing cells in the brain, adding weight to the idea that it might be the cause of multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: Prevention Is Crucial to Stem 'Tidal Wave of Cancer'
Teaser: Prevention is crucial, as even with the advances that are being made, 'we cannot treat our way out of the cancer problem,' say experts.

Headlines: California Sees High Rate of Flu Deaths in Severe Season
Teaser: An unusually severe flu season has claimed the lives of at least 147 young and middle-aged people in California - 10 times the number killed by influenza viruses by the same time last year, public health officials said.

Headlines: West African Ebola Outbreak Caused by New Strain of Disease
Teaser: An Ebola outbreak blamed for 135 deaths in West Africa in the past month was not imported from Central Africa but caused by a new strain of the disease, a study in a U.S. medical journal said, raising the spectre of further regional epidemics.

Headlines: High-Risk Adults Don't Seek Early Treatment for Flu Symptoms
Teaser: Findings highlighted the need for physicians to understand barriers for seeking care and promote benefits of early antiviral treatment.

Headlines: High-Risk HPV Prevalent in Oropharyngeal Cancers
Teaser: HPV has emerged as an independent risk factor for oropharyngeal cancers, although risk varies by sex and race/ethnicity, according to a CDC study.

Headlines: GP Recommendation Increases Acceptance of Shingles Vaccine
Teaser: Older patients are far more likely to say they intend to get vaccinated against herpes zoster if a general practitioner recommends vaccination.

Headlines: Studies Cast Doubt on Need to Stockpile Influenza Drugs
Teaser: Systematic reviews of neuraminidase inhibitor studies based on internal clinical trial documents lead researchers to question the utility of drug stockpiles.

Headlines: Vaccine Reduces Influenza Risk in Mothers and Newborns
Teaser: Vaccinating pregnant women against influenza protects both mothers and their newborns from infection, according to a new study.

Headlines: Moderate Pneumonia Protection With PCV-13 in the Elderly
Teaser: The 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV-13) offers moderate protection against pneumococcal community-acquired pneumonia for older recipients, a new study shows.

Headlines: Influenza Vaccine Keeps Kids Out of Intensive Care, CDC Says
Teaser: A CDC study has found a 75% reduced risk for intensive care for children when they are fully vaccinated against influenza.

Headlines: Sanofi Faces Make-or-Break Verdict on Big Dengue Vaccine Bet
Teaser: Sanofi expects final clinical results for its vaccine against dengue by late September and has already gambled on starting production despite some disappointing early trials data.

Headlines: Vaccination Rate Upped With Medical Home Elements
Teaser: A team-based quality control initiative has increased the immunization rate to 95% among patients aged 24 months who attended a hospital-based pediatric primary care clinic.

Headlines: Renewed Effort Needed to Fight Drug-Resistant Bacteria
Teaser: NIAID report and JAMA commentary: Robust research and incentives are required to meet the 'perpetual challenge' of antimicrobial resistance.

Headlines: First Polio Vaccine Combo Campaign Nets Almost 100% Coverage
Teaser: Kenya achieves more than 90% coverage in the first-ever polio vaccine combination campaign; polio outbreaks continue in conflicted and insecure countries.

Headlines: Neuraminidase Inhibitors May Reduce Pandemic Flu Mortality
Teaser: Meta-analysis shows neuraminidase inhibitors provide significant mortality risk reduction during an influenza pandemic.

Headlines: No Higher Vaccination Rates for HCWs Under Permissive Law
Teaser: A California law requiring influenza vaccination for healthcare personnel is not associated with increased vaccination rates compared with other states lacking such laws.

Headlines: You're Not Alone: Medical Conspiracies Believed by Many
Teaser: About half of American adults believe in at least one medical conspiracy theory, according to new survey results.

Headlines: S Aureus May Limit Immunization in Atopic Dermatitis
Teaser: People with dermatitis and Staphylococcus aureus colonization have weakened responses to intradermal vaccination, a new study shows.

Headlines: Fever Spikes More Likely When TIV, PCV13 Are Given Together
Teaser: Children receiving TIV and PCV13  together had a higher risk for transient fever than when either vaccine was given alone, according to a prospective observational cohort study.

Headlines: Mandatory Flu Vaccine for Daycare May Lower Hospitalizations
Teaser: After Connecticut required influenza vaccinations for children younger than 5 years attending licensed child care programs, vaccination rates rose by 16.3% and hospitalizations dropped by 12%.

Headlines: 'Real-World' Study Confirms Value of HPV Vaccine in Women
Teaser: The HPV vaccine provides significant protection against high-grade and other cervical abnormalities, new data from Australia show.

Headlines: South African Scientists Map HIV Antibodies in Vaccine Hunt
Teaser: Scientists in South Africa have mapped the evolution of an antibody that kills different strains of the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), which might yield a vaccine against HIV infection.

Headlines: USPSTF Shifts Course, Favors Hepatitis B Screening
Teaser: In a reversal from previous recommendations, the US Preventive Services Task Force now recommends routine screening of asymptomatic patients at high risk for hepatitis B.

Headlines: Measles Vaccine Refusal Helps Make 2014 a Record Year
Teaser: The number of measles cases through May 23 is the highest year-to-date total since 1994. The CDC attributes the spike to overseas travelers spreading the virus among unvaccinated areas of the country.

Headlines: Cholera: Cheaper Oral Vaccine Is Effective Early in Outbreak
Teaser: A less-expensive oral cholera vaccine was effective when used in an  outbreak in Guinea, supporting the addition of this vaccine to outbreak response.

Headlines: CDC Announces False Alarm on MERS Transmission
Teaser: After more testing, the agency has concluded that an Illinois man exposed to an infected business associate did not catch the Middle East Respiratory Syndrome virus after all.

Headlines: Flu Pandemic: Early Vaccinations Will Be Key, Model Projects
Teaser: If a severe influenza pandemic occurred with a virulent strain, mass vaccination within 4 to 6 months could avert as many as 11,408 deaths in a major city and would save tens of millions in costs.

Headlines: Silently Among Us: Scientists Worry About Milder Cases of MERS
Teaser: Scientists leading the fight against Middle East Respiratory Syndrome say the next critical front will be understanding how the virus behaves in people with milder infections, who may be spreading the illness without being aware they have it.

Headlines: Delaying Childhood Vaccines Ups Postvaccine Seizure Risk
Teaser: Delaying the first MMR and MMRV vaccines beyond 15 months of age may double the low risk for postvaccine seizures.

Headlines: Rotavirus Vaccination Appears Safe in NICU
Teaser: RotaTeq rotavirus vaccine administration to infants in the NICU appears to be safe, with no confirmed evidence of  infection transmission to neighboring infants.

Headlines: First-Hand Experience From Guinea Offers New Ebola Insight
Teaser: Basic practices and proper equipment for handling the dead and isolating the sick are vitally important in the fight against Ebola.

Headlines: CDC Updates HIV Preexposure Prophylaxis Guidelines
Teaser: The CDC has outlined 4 groups that should receive PrEP and emphasizes the importance of adherence to medication and routine HIV testing.

Headlines: MERS Cases Highlight Risk to Healthcare Workers
Teaser: Roughly 1 in 5 people worldwide with MERS have been healthcare workers, underlining the need for tight infection control, the CDC says.

Headlines: Vedolizumab Selectively Modulates Gut Immune Response
Teaser: The experimental drug vedolizumab  significantly reduces the humoral response to enterically administered oral cholera vaccine, but not to parenterally administered antigens.

Headlines: Pakistan's Failings to Fight Polio Spark Emergency Response
Teaser: Pakistan's failure to stem the spread of polio triggered global emergency health measures, with the World Health Organization recommending all residents must show proof of vaccination before they can leave the country.

Headlines: MERS Virus Antibodies May Lead to Treatments
Teaser: Scientists have found natural human antibodies to the newly-emerging Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) virus and say their discovery marks a step towards developing treatments for the often fatal disease.

Headlines: Pertussis Vaccine Efficacy Varies by Age, Wanes Over Time
Teaser: A new study evaluating vaccine effectiveness during a pertussis epidemic in Oregon has found that the vaccine still provided protection and should continue to be recommended.

Headlines: Measles Spike Mars CDC's Vaccination Celebration
Teaser: Federal support of immunizations is helping children born during the past 20 years avoid more than 21 million hospitalizations and 732,000 deaths, but a measles resurgence is worrisome, says the CDC.

Headlines: Trivalent Flu Vaccine for Healthy Kids as Young as 6 Months
Teaser: Trivalent influenza vaccine appears to be effective in children as young as six months old, researchers from Australia report.

Headlines: Majority of Americans Support Birth Control Coverage Mandate
Teaser: Support for mandated coverage of other preventive services, including mental health and dental services, was even higher than support for contraceptive coverage.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Safe, Immunogenic in HIV-Infected Women
Teaser: Researchers find quadrivalent HPV vaccine safe and immunogenic against 4 types of disease in HIV-infected women in a single-arm, open-label trial.

Headlines: Education Is Focus of Upcoming ACOG Clinical Meeting
Teaser: Obstetricians and gynecologists will gather in Chicago to learn and exchange ideas on everything from reproductive health choices to the optimization of women's health.

Headlines: Experimental Ebola Drugs Should Be Tried in Africa, Some Say
Teaser: People at high risk of dying in West Africa's Ebola outbreak should be offered experimental medicines to see if they work, the head of an influential global health charity said.

Headlines: Norovirus May Cause 20% of Acute Gastroenteritis Worldwide
Teaser: Norovirus is associated with nearly one fifth of all cases of acute gastroenteritis worldwide, suggesting the need for vaccines or other targeted interventions to reduce norovirus burden.

Headlines: Childhood Vaccines: Serious Adverse Events Rare
Teaser: The benefits of routine childhood vaccines outweigh the risks of rare adverse events, researchers say.

Headlines: ACIP: Influenza Spray Tops Influenza Shot for Young Children
Teaser: When available, the nasal spray vaccine is preferred for healthy children aged 2 to 8 years.

Headlines: Drastic Action Needed to Halt World's Worst Ebola Outbreak: WHO
Teaser: An Ebola outbreak that began in Guinea has turned into a cross-border crisis that could spread to more countries, the World Health Organization said, calling for drastic action to halt the deadly epidemic.

Headlines: Ohio Amish Reconsider Vaccines Amid Measles Outbreak
Teaser: County health officials are scrambling to set up immunization clinics after 341 cases in Ohio have swept through Amish communities.

Headlines: West African Ebola Epidemic 'Out of Control'
Teaser: An Ebola epidemic in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone is out of control and requires massive resources from governments and aid agencies to prevent it from spreading further, medical charity Medecins Sans Frontieres said.

Headlines: Third Meningococcal Vaccine Recommended for Children at Risk
Teaser: A third meningococcal vaccine is an additional option for children at increased risk for meningococcal disease.

Headlines: Death Toll From West Africa Ebola Hits 337: WHO Update
Teaser: The death toll from an outbreak of Ebola in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone has hit 337 since February, the WHO said, as weak local health services struggle to contain the highly contagious disease.

Headlines: Could Hepatitis B Vaccination Prevent Diabetes?
Teaser: A tantalizing new analysis of NHANES suggests that vaccinating people against hepatitis B may reduce the risk of diabetes, by up to 50%. But the hypothesis     requires testing in an interventional trial.

Headlines: Everyone Benefits When Hospital Workers Get Flu Shots
Teaser: Flu rates in the community fall when hospital workers are vaccinated against influenza, a study using California public health data has found.

Headlines: Pap vs HPV Testing: Any Screening Is Better Than None
Teaser: The HPV test alone is adequate for screening, although questions remain.

Headlines: Varicella Vaccine Reduces Incidence; No Shift to Older Kids
Teaser: Varicella vaccination decreases varicella burden directly and possibly indirectly via herd immunity.

Headlines: New Guidelines Address Alzheimer's, Tick-Borne Encephalitis
Teaser: A new European guideline identifies specific circumstances for combination drug therapy of Alzheimer's disease. Another makes recommendations for diagnosis and management of tick-borne encephalitis.

Headlines: 2011 Measles Outbreak Highlights a Familiar Pattern
Teaser: An unvaccinated child, exposed to measles in Africa, was the source case for an outbreak among a community subpopulation in Minnesota.

Headlines: Rotavirus Vaccine Greatly Reduced Healthcare Use
Teaser: Diarrhea-associated healthcare use dropped dramatically among vaccinated and unvaccinated children after vaccine introduction, with an estimated savings of nearly $1 billion in 4 years.

Headlines: 2013-2014 Flu Season a Reminder That All Ages Are at Risk
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has released recommendations for the composition of the 2014 to 2015 influenza vaccines, with no changes from the 2013-2014 vaccine composition.

Headlines: Mosquito-Borne Chikungunya Virus Spreads in the Americas
Teaser: Local transmission of the mosquito-borne chikungunya virus in the Western Hemisphere, first reported in December 2013, has now been detected in 17 Caribbean or South America countries or territories.

Headlines: Guinea, Sierra Leone See Spike in Ebola Cases: WHO
Teaser: At least 21 people died and 37 new cases of suspected Ebola were recorded in Guinea between May 29 and June 1, the WHO said, undermining the government's claims that the number of Ebola deaths was slowing.

Headlines: Uptick in Worldwide Polio Cases in 2013 Continues Into 2014
Teaser: After decades of progress toward polio eradication, public health authorities saw an 86% increase in cases between 2012 and 2013 worldwide.

Headlines: WHO Urged to Allow Experimental Drugs in 'Dire' Ebola Outbreak
Teaser: Three of the world's leading Ebola specialists called on Tuesday for experimental drugs and vaccines to be offered to people in West Africa, where a vast outbreak of the deadly disease is raging in three countries.

Headlines: BCG Vaccination Protects Against Tuberculosis Infection
Teaser: Children should be vaccinated against tuberculosis as soon as possible after birth in countries with a high incidence of tuberculosis.

Headlines: Ebola: Are Treatments, Vaccines on the Horizon?
Teaser: An experimental serum grown in specially modified tobacco leaves made headlines this week when it was given to two Americans stricken with Ebola.

Headlines: Artemisinin-Resistant Malaria Spreads, Threatens Gains
Teaser: Artemisinin-resistant malaria is prevalent in mainland Southeast Asia; investigators are testing a new, potent antimalarial that could help in the fight.

Headlines: Suspend Work, Close Most Biosafety Labs, Experts Say
Teaser: Anthrax exposure at 2 CDC research labs has sparked calls for a new national authority to oversee the safety and management of biocontainment labs, as well as recommendations that many be closed.

Headlines: Adolescents, Not Infants, Targeted for Meningococcal Vaccine
Teaser: Only high-risk infants should receive meningococcal vaccines, according to the newest AAP recommendations.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Uptake Remains 'Unacceptably Low'
Teaser: According to the latest government survey, there was only a slight increase in uptake of the HPV vaccine in adolescent girls.

Headlines: GSK Seeks Approval for World's First Malaria Vaccine
Teaser: GlaxoSmithKline said it is applying for regulatory approval for the world's first vaccine against malaria, designed for children in Africa.

Headlines: Sierra Leone's Chief Ebola Doctor Contracts the Virus
Teaser: The head doctor fighting the deadly tropical virus Ebola in Sierra Leone has himself caught the disease, the government said.

Headlines: Fewer Vulvar HPV Infections After HPV16/18 Vaccine
Teaser: Women who receive the bivalent HPV16/18 vaccine have lower rates of vulvar human papillomavirus (HPV) infection, according to results from the Costa Rica Vaccine Trial.

Headlines: Threat Rises in U.S. From Mosquito-Borne Chikungunya Virus
Teaser: The first two locally acquired cases of a painful mosquito-borne viral illness, chikungunya, have been reported in Florida, health officials confirmed.

Headlines: Full-Dose Trivalent Flu Vaccine Safe for Kids Age 6 to 35 Months
Teaser: Children 6 to 35 months old can safely be given a full dose of seasonal trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (TIV), a new study suggests.

Headlines: First Chikungunya Case Acquired in US Reported in Florida
Teaser: The first case of locally acquired mosquito-born chikungunya virus in the United States has been confirmed in a Florida man, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention announced.

Headlines: $17.1 Million Prize for Solving Antibiotic Resistance
Teaser: A bounty of 10 million pounds ($17.1 million) will be awarded for an inexpensive, quick, and accurate point-of-care test for identifying or ruling out bacterial infections.

Headlines: Measles Cases Hit 18-Year High in Washington State
Teaser: Washington state health officials reported on Thursday the highest number of measles cases since 1996 and urged residents to seek vaccinations against the preventable disease during the state's third outbreak of the virus this year.

Headlines: Extra Inactivated Polio Vaccine Dose Boosts Immunity
Teaser: Inactivated polio vaccine boosted immunity in children who received the oral polio vaccine series, with implications for global eradication.

Headlines: Doctors Should Do More to Encourage Flu Shots During Pregnancy
Teaser: Most doctors do not recommend flu shots to their pregnant patients, who are more likely to develop serious complications if they do get the flu, according to a new meta-analysis.

Headlines: How to Fix a Broken Market in Antibiotics
Teaser: The drugs don't work - and neither does the market, when it comes to antibiotics.

Headlines: Infectious Diseases Still Major Public Health Issue, CDC Says
Teaser: Infectious diseases remain an important public health issue, despite progress on some fronts and continued efforts at control, according to the CDC.

Headlines: PCV-13 May Not Fully Protect Children With Comorbidity
Teaser: Among children vaccinated with PCV13, invasive pneumococcal disease is more common in those with comorbidities, suggesting routine vaccination may not be enough to reduce this risk.

Headlines: New RSV Drug Reduced Viral Activity in Healthy Adults‏
Teaser: In a double-blind, placebo-controlled study, treatment with GS-5806, an oral RSV entry inhibitor, reduced the viral load and the severity of clinical disease in healthy adults.

Headlines: Tekmira Drug Saves Monkeys With Marburg Fever
Teaser: An experimental drug from Tekmira Pharmaceuticals Corp helped lab monkeys recover from the most deadly strain of Marburg virus, a close cousin of Ebola, even after symptoms appeared.

Headlines: Experimental Ebola Drugs Needed for 'Up to 30,000 People'
Teaser: Up to 30,000 people could have used experimental treatments or vaccines so far in the world's worst outbreak of Ebola currently plaguing West Africa, British scientists said on Wednesday.

Headlines: High Stroke Risk Transient After Infection in Kids
Teaser: Researchers have identified a 3-day transient window of highest stroke risk in children following a minor infection.

Headlines: All Pregnant Women Should Get Influenza Vaccine, ACOG Says
Teaser: With new study data available, the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists has strengthened its recommendations on influenza vaccine, emphasizing benefits for mother and infant.

Headlines: Intralesional Mycobacterium W Vaccine for Anogenital Warts
