Teaser: An aborted fetus had brain development 4 SD below average and calcifications in the central nervous system. Editorialists call for rapid distribution of quicker and more accurate diagnostic tests.

Headlines: Vaginal Ring Trial Results a Big Draw at HIV Meeting
Teaser: This year's CROI will focus on the prevention and transmission of HIV and the treatment of opportunistic infections, such as Ebola and hepatitis B.

Headlines: Despite Media, Parents Unaware of Disneyland Measles Outbreak
Teaser: Parents who were most aware of the outbreak also expressed concerns about the safety and efficacy of immunization, according to the survey.

Headlines: Vaccinate to Prevent AF? Risk in Seniors Falls After Flu Shot
Teaser: And the risk of atrial fibrillation rose for those who didn't get vaccinated, in a preliminary study that some say hints that flu shots "could represent     another simple, cost-effective intervention to prevent AF."

Headlines: Immunotherapy Is ASCO's Advance of the Year
Teaser: The organization's annual report highlights clinical cancer advances that have been made in the past year, and says immunotherapy 'clearly stands out from the rest.'

Headlines: Could Flu Shots Lower Hospitalization, Dementia Risk in HF?
Teaser: One study showed a 35% lower dementia risk, whereas another "provides the most compelling evidence to date for the protective effect of influenza     vaccination on hospital admissions," say researchers.

Headlines: Tracking the Rise of Zika Complications
Teaser: A new look at the timeline of the recent explosion of Zika cases examines what is known about the neuroimmunologic effects. WFN guidelines for these complications are in the works.

Headlines: Low American HPV Vaccine Rates Mean Less Herd Immunity
Teaser: Prevalence rates have dropped in the United States, but low vaccination rates mean less widespread immunity, researchers say.

Headlines: New Acute, Chronic HF Guidelines Debut at ESC Heart Failure 2016
Teaser: The art of medicine as it applies to heart failure will be on display in Florence for 4 days, as new European guidelines debut with fanfare along with     thousands of research presentations.

Headlines: Yellow Fever Concerns Grow, WHO Urged to Set Up Emergency Panel
Teaser: A growing yellow fever epidemic in Africa and Latin American led to calls for the WHO director-general to convene an emergency response committee, partly because of an anticipated vaccine shortage.

Headlines: Flu Strikes Fewer Infants When Pregnant Women Get Vaccinated
Teaser: Infants have a much lower risk of getting influenza when their mothers are vaccinated against the virus during pregnancy, a U.S. study confirms.

Headlines: Should Europe Be Worried About Zika Virus This Summer?
Teaser: With the arrival of warm weather, and with it, mosquitoes, is there a risk for a Zika epidemic in Europe?

Headlines: Intradermal Varicella-Zoster Vaccine Elicits Greater Antibody Response
Teaser: Intradermal administration of varicella-zoster virus vaccine elicits a greater antibody response in older adults than does subcutaneous administration at comparable doses, researchers have reported.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine May Benefit Higher-Risk Women Older Than 26
Teaser: Newly detected high-risk human papillomavirus (HR-HPV) infections in mid-adult women are often redetections of previous infections, according to new research.

Headlines: US Preparedness for Public Health Emergencies Improving
Teaser: The United States is more prepared to deal with large-scale public health emergencies but is losing ground on its ability to monitor for environmental hazards and keep water and food supplies safe.

Headlines: Early Ultrasounds May Miss Zika-Induced Microcephaly
Teaser: Zika virus fetal brain damage was undetectable by ultrasound through week 17 of gestation. Experts called for serial fetal ultrasound and brain MRI if Zika RNA levels remain high in maternal serum.

Headlines: Ending the Spread of Hepatitis B and C Doable, Report Says
Teaser: Hepatitis B and C could be eliminated as public health problems in the United States, but it will take a lot of dedication and hard work, a new Academies report shows.

Headlines: ASCO Urges Aggressive Efforts to Increase HPV Vaccination
Teaser: Despite many American medical professional bodies strongly recommending HPV vaccination, uptake remains low. Now oncologists are being told to get involved.

Headlines: Vaccination of Preemies With BPD: Risk for Decompensation Low
Teaser: The risk for respiratory decompensation after vaccination of preterm infants with BPD is comparable to that of preterm infants without BPD, according to a new retrospective study.

Headlines: USPSTF: No COPD Screening for Asymptomatic Adults
Teaser: USPSTF continued its 2008 recommendation against COPD screening in asymptomatic adults.

Headlines: Human Metapneumovirus Season Identified
Teaser: The virus begins circulating in winter and lasts until spring, peaking later in the year than RSV or influenza, researchers found.

Headlines: EMA Panel Backs Pandemic Avian Influenza Vaccine
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency's Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use has recommended granting marketing authorization for the Pandemic Live Attenuated Influenza Vaccine.

Headlines: Experts Warn Complacency on Ebola May Leave Vaccine Work Unfinished
Teaser: The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared the Ebola emergency over, but action is still needed to fully develop effective vaccines and prepare the world for future outbreaks, experts said on Thursday.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Side-Effects Class-Action Suit Planned in Japan
Teaser: Lawyers representing girls with adverse effects after HPV vaccination are preparing a lawsuit against the government and the manufacturers.

Headlines: Seasonal Influenza Vaccine May Halve Risk for Stillbirth
Teaser: Stillbirth was 51% less likely among women vaccinated against seasonal influenza compared with among unvaccinated women in a large, population-based study.

Headlines: Suspected Congo Yellow Fever Cases up 38 Percent in Last Three Weeks
Teaser: The number of suspected yellow fever cases in the Democratic Republic of Congo has jumped 38 percent in the last three weeks, the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Friday, as health officials prepare to launch a vaccination campaign next week.

Headlines: Safety of 9-Valent HPV Vaccine Comparable to qvHPV
Teaser: Analysis of the safety profile of the new 9-valent HPV vaccine shows injection-site reactions are more common than they are with the quadrivalent vaccine.

Headlines: FDA Expands Use of Pfizer's Best-Selling Pneumonia Vaccine
Teaser: Pfizer Inc said on Tuesday the U.S. Food and Drug Administration had expanded the use of its best-selling pneumonia vaccine, Prevnar, to adults aged 18 through 49.

Headlines: Titanic Shift in Attitude Anticipated at AIDS 2016
Teaser: Since the International AIDS Conference was last held in South Africa, politics have caught up to science, and access to treatment and prevention will now be on the agenda.

Headlines: Bring Back HPV Vaccination, Say Japanese Experts
Teaser: The Japanese government withdrew its recommendation for the HPV vaccine because of concern over side effects, but some physicians are urging the government to reconsider.

Headlines: HPV-Associated Cancers on Rise in US
Teaser: Human papillomavirus-associated cancers include, most notably, those of the cervix and oropharynx. The majority of these cancers are attributable to the virus.

Headlines: Maternal Flu Vaccination Protects Baby Only for a Short Spell
Teaser: The duration of infant protection against influenza afforded by immunizing pregnant women with trivalent inactivated influenza vaccine is likely to be limited to the first eight weeks of life, new research suggests.

Headlines: Complaint Filed Over Handling of HPV Vaccine Safety Issues
Teaser: An official complaint has been lodged by the Nordic Cochrane Center over the EMA's review last year of the safety of human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccines.

Headlines: Zika Vaccine Clinical Trials to Start in Humans This Month
Teaser: A Zika virus DNA vaccine has entered phase 1 testing in humans, and two other Zika vaccines that protected mice from infection after a single dose are heading for human studies this year.

Headlines: Reduced HPV Vaccine Dosing Could Be Worthwhile
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration recommends three doses of the human papillomavirus vaccine (HPV), but recent data suggest that fewer shots might be sufficient.

Headlines: ACIP Backs Cholera, MenACWY Vaccines
Teaser: The ACIP recommended cholera vaccination for adults traveling to affected areas and routine MenACWY vaccination for HIV-infected persons aged 2 months and older.

Headlines: ACIP Nixes Nasal Spray Influenza Vaccine for Next Season
Teaser: The CDC's ACIP has recommended that live attenuated influenza vaccine, the nasal spray influenza vaccine, should not be used because it was ineffective during the last three influenza seasons.

Headlines: Immunizing Infants Against Hepatitis B Tied to Lower Risk of Liver Cancer
Teaser: Immunizing infants against hepatitis B virus (HBV) appears to reduce their risk of developing hepatocellular carcinoma as children or young adults, according to a study from Taiwan.

Headlines: Universal Flu Vaccine in the Works
Teaser: A novel approach that targets a vulnerability unique to the influenza A virus could lead to vaccines that provide broad and durable protection against current and future flu strains.

Headlines: Bill Gates, Jennifer Doudna Will Take Podium at ASM Microbe
Teaser: More than 10,000 delegates are expected at the American Society for Microbiology (ASM) Microbe 2016 conference, where Bill Gates and DNA-editing revolutionary Jennifer Doudna will take the stage.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Cholera Vaccine in the US
Teaser: The FDA approved a single-dose vaccine for the prevention of cholera in adults from the US aged 18 through 64 years.

Headlines: In Yellow Fever War, WHO Readies Plan to Stretch Vaccine Supply
Teaser: The worst yellow fever outbreak in decades, which has killed 325 people in Angola and spread as far as China, has prompted the World Health Organization (WHO) to draw up plans to eke out vaccine supplies by using one-fifth of the normal dose.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Bezlotoxumab for C diff Recurrence Prevention
Teaser: Some  panelists felt the backing studies were well done, but also wanted further information on the safety of the drug for some patients.

Headlines: Risk for Febrile Seizure After Multiple Vaccines Is Low
Teaser: The incidence of febrile seizures in children 6 to 23 months of age increased when multiple vaccines are given at once, but the absolute risk remains low, according to new data.

Headlines: Scientists' Progress Towards a Cancer Vaccine
Teaser: German scientists have reported making progress towards a vaccine against cancer.

Headlines: Speeding the Pace of Influenza Vaccine Development
